Madame Agnès Berthé est âgée de 36 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec seulement ses 3 enfants (puisque son mari est partie en exode)  dans le quartier Koko de la préfecture de  Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Madame Agnès n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, elle  s’est donc très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus plus précisément la transformation des noix de néré en sounbala (un condiment traditionnel très prisé au Mali et dans la sous région Ouest Africaine) auprès de sa maman comme d’ailleurs toutes les femmes de son  ethnie les  Minianka.  
Cette activité est très rentable car elle peut transformer 2 sacs de 100 kg de noix de néré en sounbala par semaine, ce qui  lui procure assez de revenus.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité et en qualité, madame n’a pas pris du temps pour faire  recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis maintenant 1 ans.  Elle  est à son deuxième   prêt  individuel, le précèdent a été correctement payé.  
Ce prêt nouveau servira à constituer un grand stock de noix de néré, au grand marché  de la ville de Koutiala, auprès des grossistes. Madame Agnès vend au comptant et en gros ses  productions de sounbala à Sikasso et souvent à Bamako,  à une clientèle composée de femmes et de revendeurs. 
 Avec l’augmentation  de sa matière première, elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiens de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agnès Berthé, 36, lives in a monogamous family, with just her three children (because her husband has gone abroad), in the Koko neighborhood of the prefecture of Koutiala (Sikasso region).

Madame Agnès did not have the good fortune to go to school, so she began to work at money-earning activities early on, to be precise, at transforming 'néré' nuts into 'sounbala' (a condiment which is traditionally much prized in Mali and West Africa) together with her mother, as well as all the women of her ethnicity, the ' Minianka' people. This work is very remunerative since she can turn 2 sacks of 100 kg of 'néré' nuts into 'sounbala' every week, bringing in a good deal of income.

In order to satisfy her clientele as far as quality and quantity go, she turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso a year ago. She is on her second individual loan, the first having been correctly reimbursed.

This new loan will serve to buy a large stock of 'néré' nuts, in the big open-air market of the town of Koutiala, from wholesalers. Madame Agnès retails and wholesales her "sounbala' in Sikasso and often in Bamako, to a clientele composed of women and of other retailers.

With the increase in her raw material, she hopes to see a monthly profit of 120,000 F CFA which she will use to repay the interest on the loan and cover the daily living expenses of her family, investing any remainder back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 'néré' nuts

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years old, is single, and currently lives alone. He enjoys selling goods, the business where he makes a living.

Joseph has been selling tubers of yam for five years now to support himself. He treks to farming communities to buy his stock of yams from the farmers. This saves him from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell to him at a higher price.

Joseph wants to use the loan to buy yams in bulk to meet the daily demands of his customers. He hopes to use part of his profit to support the business and to save the rest.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en:
Chingiz was born in 1957 and lives in Fuzuli region. He is married and has three children.

Seven years ago, Chingiz started this business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his house-repairing business.

loans.use: To buy necessary things to improve his business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Three of her children are currently in school. She enjoys selling goods, a business which provides her with her daily income. She has been selling yams for four years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy yams wholesale from the farmers. This saves her from having to deal with intermediaries who buy from the farmers and then resell the yams at a higher price. She wants to use the loan to buy yams in bulk in order to meet the daily demands of her customers, especially as Christmas approaches. She hopes to use part of the profit she earns to support her kids in school, and another part to expand her business. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: purchasing yams in bulk

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam D. est âgée  de 39 ans mariée et mère de 1 enfant, elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier  Sogomougou de la ville de Koutiala( Région de Sikasso ). 
N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études, elle a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus depuis son jeune âge qu’elle appris auprès de sa maman. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle décida finalement d’opter pour le commerce général, avec la vente de diverses marchandises  il y a 10 ans. 
Pour  l’agrandissement de son activité,  Madame a fait  recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a  3 ans.  Après   3 prêts  solidaires ( prêt de groupe ) tous payés correctement, elle est à son 1er  prêt  individuel.  
Avec ce financement elle compte acheter une grande quantités de marchandises d’articles divers à Bamako (capitale Mali). Elle est ambulante et effectue sa vente dans la  ville  de Koutiala   à une clientèle essentiellement féminine, au comptant, en détail et à crédit. 
Avec l’augmentation de son fonds de commerce, elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de l’échéance du prêt et contribuer aux petites dépenses de sa famille.  
Elle ambitionne solliciter un financement plus important qui pourra lui permettre d’élargir tout en agrandissant ses activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam D., 39, is married and the mother of one child. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-spouse, and their children, in the Sogomougou neighborhood of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region).

Not having had the good fortune to succeed brilliantly at school, she took up money-earning activities when she was still quite young, learning from her mother. After having tried a number of businesses, she finally decided to sell general merchandise 10 years ago.

In order to expand her business, Mrs. D. came to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. After three solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, she is now on her first individual loan.

With this loan, she intends to buy big quantities of various items in Bamako (capital of Mali). She sells door-to-door in the town of Koutiala, to a clientele that is essentially female, for cash and retail, and for credit.

With the expansion of her working capital, she hopes to make a profit of 50,000 F CFA per month which she will use to reimburse the loan and contribute to her family's living expenses. Her ambition is to qualify for a larger loan which will allow her to really expand her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Madalena Manuel

texts.pt:
Madalena N. nasceu em chokwe, Província de Gaza, ao sul de Moçambique, tem 30 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 13,10,5 e 1 anos de idade. Não estudou porque o pai não sustentou as despesas escolares, vivia com uma outra esposa na Republica da Africa do Sul. Vive na casa própria construída na base de material precário em Boane com a família e para alem desta sustenta a Sogra (mãe do Marido) enviando alguns géneros alimentícios.

Saiu de Chokwe em 1997 com a mãe para a casa da tia em Boane, provincia de Maputo, começa a trabalhar numa empresa agrícola de produção e venda de Banana (Bananalandia) com o seu esposo. Actualmente trabalha das 6h as 14h auferindo um salário de 1.630.00mt, poupa algum no fim de mes com colegas através de Xitique e o marido tem ajudado sempre nas despesas caseiras.

Nunca trabalhou com outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, cimento, areia ferro e outros).

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo afim de aceder a mais créditos no futuro concluir a sua obra e oferecer a sua família melhores condições de acomodação.
texts.en:
Madalena N. was born in Chokwe, province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique, she is 30 years old and is married and has 4 children who are 13, 10, 5 and 1 years old. She didn't studied because her father didn't support any school endeavours, as he lived with another wife in the Republic of South Africa. She lives in her own house built of very poor material in Boane with her family and besides her family she supports her mother in law sending her food. She left Chokwe in 1997 with her mother to live at her aunts' house in Boane, province of Maputo, started working at an agricultural company that produces and sells bananas (Bananlandia) with her husband. Currently she works from 6 am to 2 pm with a salary of 1.630MT, she saves some money with co-workers thru Xitique and her husband always helps with the household. She never requested credit from other institutions, she learned about Hluvuku tru co-workers who are clients too, and this is her first loan for 10.000MT which she expects to use to buy construction material (rock, cement, sand, iron, among others). She promises to pay on time the loan in order to access to more credits in the future and finish her house to offer her family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and others)

loans.name: Mariano Marcos

texts.pt:
Mariano F. nasceu em Montepuez, Província de Cabo Delgado, tem 47 anos de idade, pai de 3 filhos de 18,16 e 11 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 10ª classe parou porque os pais não tinham condições financeiras, assim viu se obrigado a começar a trabalhar para ajudar nas despesas de casa. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta também sua mãe em Montepuez enviando dinheiro para o pagamento de energia, agua e alguns géneros alimentícios.

Saiu de Montepuez em 1979 para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório em Maputo. Continua como militar e é quadro do Ministério da defesa Nacional. Aufere um salário no valor de 6.555.00mt e, depois das despesas caseiras, poupa algum no Banco Comercial BIM. 

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu colega e assim decidiu aproximar a instituição, nunca teve empréstimos em outras instituições de crédito. Este é o seu 1º crédito nesta organização no valor de 10.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pregos, ferro, cimento, arame e chapas de Zinco) para fazer a cobertura da sua casa.

O desafio tem sido o elevado preço de material de construção, mas compromete se a pagar este empréstimo sem problemas afim de pedir os próximos, concluir a sua obra e sair da antiga casa que foi feita na base de material precário.
texts.en:
Mariano F. was born in Montepuez, province of Cabo Delgado, he is 47 years old and has 3 children who are 18,16 and 11 years old, they all go to school. He finished the 10th grade because his parents didn't have financial resources, so he had to start working to help at home. He lives in his own house with his family and he also supports his mother in Montepuez sending her money to pay electricity, water and food. He left Montepuez in 1979 to fulfill the military service which is obligatory in Maputo. He continues in the army and is part of the Ministry of National Defense. He earns a salary of 6.555MT and after household expenses he is able to save some money at the Commercial Bank BIM. He learned about Hlvuku thru a co-worker so he decided to approach the institution, he doesn't have credit at other financial institutions. This is his first loan for 10.000MT, and he expects to use it to buy construction materials (nails, iron, cement, wires and metal sheets of zinc) to build the frame of his house. His biggest challenge has been the price increase of construction materials, but he promises to pay the loan without any problems in order to request other loans to finish his house and leave the old house that was built out of precarious material.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and others)

loans.name: Almeida Jaime

texts.pt:
Almeida U. nasceu em Chibuto, na Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 33 anos de idade, pai de 2 filhos de 9 e 2 anos de idade e um vai a escola. Fez somente 2ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de visão do ensino por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a sua sogra enviando géneros alimentícios mensalmente. A sua esposa trabalha numa empresa de produção de ovos (GALOVOS) e tem ajudado nas despesas de casa.

Saiu de Gaza em 1996 para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida e começou fazendo pequenos negócios ambulatório nos bairros de Boane, Mafuiane e outros. Em 2003 começa a trabalhar numa empresa de produção e venda de banana (Bananalandia) ate hoje, onde aufere um salário de 1.630.00mt por mês e poupa algum através de Xitique com colegas.

Nunca solicitou empréstimos em outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço e este é o seu 1º crédito no valor de 10.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, janelas, portas e cimento) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.

Tem como objectivo primário neste empréstimo melhorar as condições de habitabilidade para a família, comprometendo se a pagar o credito sem problemas, para aceder a mais empréstimos no futuro afim de concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
Almeida U. was born in Chibuto, in the Province of Gaza, south Mozambique. He is 33 years old and the father of two children age 9 and 2, one of whom goes to school. He only completed two years of school and didn't continue since his parents had no vision for education. He lives with his family in his own home and supports his mother-in-law by sending foodstuffs monthly. His wife works in an egg production company (GALOVOS), and has been helping with the household expenses.

He left Gaza for Maputo in 1996 seeking better living conditions and started doing small ambulatory sales in the neighborhoods of Boane, Mafuiane and others. In 2003 he started work in a banana production and sales company (Bananalandia) where he works to this day, and where he earns a salary of 1630 Meticais per month, saving some through an informal savings and credit arrangement (Xitique) with colleagues.

He never requested a loan from other credit institutions, and learned about Hluvuku from work colleagues. This is his first loan in the amount of 10,000 Meticais, with which he plans to purchase construction materials (galvanized roofing sheets, windows, doors and cement) to continue with his work.

The primary objective of this loan is to improve housing conditions for his family, and he promises to pay back the loan without problems in order to receive more loans in the future to complete his house.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en: Salomey is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Three of her children are currently in school. She enjoys selling goods, a business that provides her with her daily income. She has been selling yams for five years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities like Atebubu and Techiman in order to buy the yams directly from the farmers, thus avoiding the use of intermediaries, who would buy from the farmers and resell the yams to her at a higher price. She wants to use the loan to buy yams in bulk in order to meet the daily demands of her customers as we approach Christmas. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school and another part of her profit to expand business to the desired level. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: purchasing yams in bulk

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is 35 years old. She is married and is the mother of two children, both of whom are currently in school. She enjoys selling goods, a business which provides her with her daily income. She has been selling yams for five years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities like Atebubu and Techiman to buy her yams from the farmers. This saves her from having to deal with intermediaries, who buy from the farmers and then resell the yams at a higher price. She wants to use the loan to buy yams in bulk in order to meet the daily demands of her customers, especially as we approach Christmas. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school, and another part to expand business to the desired level. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: purchasing yams in bulk

loans.name: Regina Rafael

texts.pt:
Regina B. nasceu em Chibuto, Província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 45 anos de idade, divorciada mãe de 2 filhos, de 25 e 18 anos de idade, o mais novo esta a estudar. Estudou ate 5ª classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pelos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com os seus 2 folhos e sustenta também a sua mãe que vivi em Mahelane Distrito de Namaacha, enviando lhe géneros alimentícios.

Saíram de Chibuto 1992 a Maputo (bairro de Hulene) em casa de seus familiares, quando divorciou se do marido, enfrentando varias dificuldade na sua vida decide mudar se para Mahelane a procura de emprego. Começa a trabalhar em 2002 numa empresa de produção e venda de Banana (Bananalandia) onde trabalha cerca de 12h por dia. Esta actividade aprendeu com os pais em Chibuto desde 1972.

Nunca trabalhou com outras instituições de credito, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua sobrinha e colega de serviço que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, pedra, ferro, cimento e chapas de zinco) para melhorar a sua residência.

Tem como desafios no seu plano, o elevado preço de material de construção, para isso compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo, a fim de aceder a mais créditos no futuro e concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Regina B. was born in Chibuto, province of Gaza, in the south of Mozambique. She is 45 years old, divorced and mother of two, who are 25 and 18 years old. The younger of her children is attending school. She has studied up to 5th grade, and she hasn't continued to study because of her parents' financial problems. She lives in her own house with her two sons. She also supports her mother, who lives in Mahelane, Namaacha district, by sending her food.

They left Chibuto in 1992 to Maputo (Hulene neighborhood) for a relative's house when she divorced her husband. They were facing various difficulties in life and she decided to move to Mahelane and search for work. She started working in 2002 in a company that produces and sells banana (Bananalandia). There, she works about 12 hours a day. She has learned this activity from her parents in Chibuto, in 1972.

She has never worked with other credit institutions. She learned about Hluvuku from a niece and co-worker, who is also one of the institution's clients. This is her first loan, of MZN 10,000.00 ($350). She intends to use this money to improve her house, buying construction materials (sand, stones, steel, cement and zinc sheets).

One of her challenges is the price of the construction materials. For this reason, she undertakes to pay properly her debit in order to have access to new loans in the future and so, conclude the construction.


Translated from Portuguese by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials (cement, sand, zinc sheets and others)

loans.name: Ijairo Augusto

texts.pt:
Ijairo M. nasceu em Panda, na Província de Inhambane, tem 35 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 15,13,12,11 e 2 anos de idade, os 4 mais velhos frequentam a escola. Fez nível médio profissional, vive na casa própria com a família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Panda em 1995 para Maputo com a sua família, transferido pelos serviços. É funcionário do estado no Ministério da Educação como Docente há 14 anos, faz em media 8 por dia e ganha um salário de 9.000.00mt por mês. É também dono de um negócio, trabalha com a sua esposa vendendo refrigerantes e outras bebidas. Conseguem arrecadar cerca de 10.000.00mt, a 15.000.00mt por mês e poupam algum no banco, todos os meses.

Já teve empréstimos no Banco comercial BIM e decidiu não continuar quando conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o 3º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos para o seu negócio (refrescos, cerveja e vinhos). Os anteriores valores foram de 11.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

Enfrenta dificuldades falta de energia eléctrica para desenvolver a sua actividade e é que obrigado a usar congelador a gás, que é pouco económico. Mas, com este empréstimo vai aumentar bastante mente a sua receita, através da aquisição de mais produtos para satisfazer o seu mercado.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para melhorar o seu estabelecimento comercial, residência e adquirir um meio de transporte próprio.
texts.en:
Ijairo M. was born in Panda, in the province of Inhambane. He is 35 years old, married and the father of five children aged 15, 13, 12, 11 and two years old. The four oldest children go to school. He completed professional middle school, and lives in his own house with his family and does not support any others.

He left Panda with his family in 1995 for Maputo, transferred by work. He has been a state functionary for 14 years as a teacher in the Ministry of Education, working on average eight hours per day and earning a salary of 9000 Meticais a month. He is also owner of a shop, and works with his wife selling sodas and other drinks. They manage to bring in between 10,000 and 15,000 Meticais monthly, and save something in the bank every month.

He had loans from the commercial BIM bank, and decided not to continue when he learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is a client of the organization. This is the third loan, in the amount of 25,000 Meticais, with which he intends to buy products for his shop (soft drinks, beer and wines). The previous amounts were 11,000 Meticais and 18,000 Meticais, both for the same business.

He encountered difficulties growing his business due to a lack of electricity, which obliged him to use an uneconomical gas refrigerator. But with this loan he will increase his income sufficiently, by acquiring additional products to satisfy his market.

In the future he plans to request additional loans to improve his commercial establishment and residence, and to acquire his own means of transportation.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of soft drinks

loans.name: Gilda Jose

texts.pt:
Gilda U. nasceu em Xai xai, na Província de Gaza no sul de Moçambique, tem 59 anos de idade, viúva mãe de 5 filhos de 45,40,35,30 e 24 anos de idade, o mais novo ainda vai a escola. Estudou ate 4ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria no bairro Luís Cabral em Maputo, para alem dos filhos sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Xai xai com os seus pais, ainda muito pequena, para Maputo. Mais tarde casou e mudou de residência para o bairro onde reside actualmente e, depois do falecimento do marido, que trabalhava nos Caminhos de Ferro de Moçambique, passou a receber a pensão de sobrevivência no valor de 2.714.00mt. poupa algum através de sistema tradicional de poupança (Xitique).

Já levantou 7 empréstimos numa cooperativa de crédito (CCOM) para ampliação da sua casa. Depois de muitas conversas com amigas acerca de credito, conheceu a Sr.ª Isaura funcionaria da Hluvuku e decidiu solicitar empréstimos nesta instituição, sendo este o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente o presente empréstimo para poder aceder a mais créditos no futuro afim de poder concluir a sua obra e iniciar a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Gilda U. was born in Xai Xai, in the province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. She is a 59 year old widow and mother of five children 45, 40, 35, 30 and 24 years of age. The youngest child still goes to school. Gilda studied up to the fourth grade, but didn't continue due to her parent's lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house in the neighborhood of Luis Cabral in Maputo. In addition to her children she takes care of two grandchildren who live with her.

She left Xai Xai with her parents for Maputo while she was still very young. Later she married and moved to the neighborhood where she currently lives. After the death of her husband who worked for the Mozambique Railways, she received a survivor's pension in the amount of 2714 Meticais. She saves some through the traditional "Xitique" savings system.

She has already raised seven loans with a credit cooperative (CCOM) to enlarge her house. Following many discussions about credit with her friends, she met Mr. Isaura, an employee of Hluvuku, and decided to request loans from this organization. This is her first loan, in the amount of 25,000 Meticais, with which she intends to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, iron and others) to continue her work.

She promises to pay off the current loan in due course in order to take on additional loans in the future with the goal of completing work on her house and starting commercial activities.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, stone, sand, iron and other materials)

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace produces and sells cellophane at retail prices to her customers within her community in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 44 years old and is married with 3 children. Her husband is a commercial tailor. She has been in this business since 2000. She is hoping for a loan amount of N 100,000, with which she will purchase more materials. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more materials with which to make cellophane

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client has been running a printing shop for seven years and has become very skilled at it. He has applied for this loan to purchase ink, toner, paper and parts for his printer.  The client currently has two employees and is planning on hiring more help.

loans.use: To purchase ink, toner, paper and parts for the printer

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 35 years old. She is married and is the mother of five children. She is a very hardworking woman who works hard to take care of her children. Her children are currently in school. Christiana is a producer of gari grains. She sells gari grains in bulk in a local market. Gari is prepared from milled cassava. She gets her stock delivered from nearby communities and distributes it during market days. She has a large customer base, but she no longer has enough funds to buy more stock. With your assistance, she believes that she could buy more stock, increase her profit, and consequently be able to provide a better education for her children. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: purchasing gari grains

loans.name: Philo

texts.en:
Philo owns a grocery store where she sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She is a hardworking woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She opens her stall daily from 8:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is 48 years old and married with five children.

Philo is requesting for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua currently lives with her two children and her husband in a mining community in the central region of Ghana. All her children are in school in the community where they live.

Akosua is 55 years old and very supportive of her family. She trades in Chinese herbal medicines in bulk. She takes her supply of goods from importers in Kumasi and retails them to her customers. She mostly sells through hawking in the market center.

Akosua wants the loan assistance to boost her stock, to raise sales, and to create a substantial profit.

loans.use: To buy Chinese medicines in bulk

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa currently lives with her husband and six other children. She has one grandson who is in school but all her children are grownup and are living on their own.

Yaa is 54 years old and very supportive of her family. She trades in Chinese herbal medicines in bulk and is a manufacturer of local medicine. She combines herbs from the forest to prepare the local medicine which is proved to cure diseases like fever, piles, malaria, etc. She obtains her supply of Chinese medicines from importers in Kumasi and retails them (hand in hand) with the local medicine. She mostly sells through hawking in the local market centre.

Yaa wants the loan assistance to buy materials to prepare local medicine and to boost her stock to raise sales and create a substantial profit.

loans.use: To buy materials to prepare local medicine and to boost her stock

loans.name: Itejere

texts.en:
Ovwigho is 60 years old and married with two children. She sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. The demand for cooking oil in her community is high because cooking oil is important in the preparation of local soup.

This is the high season for sales and Ovwigho hopes to make more profits during this season. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old and a married mother of five children, four of whom are in school. She always works hard to meet her targets and has acquired lots of sales and marketing experience. Elizabeth is a farmer (of carrots) and also trades in vegetables and spices, such as tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc., at the community market. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding villages and retails them to her customers. She sells her goods from a table-top.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy carrots, tomatoes, onions and other spices etc. to upgrade her stock. She dreams of saving more in order to take care of her children's educational needs. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale, such as carrots, tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a businesswoman trading in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials, selling mostly through hawking, a  method that moves her merchandise very quickly,  A 65-year divorced mother of seven grown children, Ama is very supportive of her family through her trading business which she has been operating for about 20 years now. Through the purchase of bulk torn cloth to increase her inventory, she hopes the loan will enable her to strengthen the business and make larger profits. Ama would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Handatu

texts.en: Handatu is 32 years old. She is married and a mother of two children. All of her children are in school. Her family is doing very well, and she is so happy about that. Vida is in the service industry, sewing dresses as a seamstress. She has been sewing for two years and is a specialist in lady wears. Her skills and designs are unique. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, clothing such as; children school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit wedding dress, funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to increase her supplies of sewing material like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings and provide her children with quality education. She would be grateful for your assistance and support.

loans.use: To increase supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to improve her output and efficiency

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is married and the mother of seven children. She is 40 years old and currently living with her family. She is avery hard working woman and committed to her work. She prepares and sells doughnuts and meat pies in her neighborhood and sells "flip-flop"  (which is prepared from flour) in the market place.  Her pastry, dough nuts and meat pies are mostly purchased by the school children. She sells the rest through hawking. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She requests the loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine etc. to increase her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, sugar, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. She is 51 years old and she is married with 5 children. She hopes to be a major distributor of cooking oil in her community in the future. Evelyn has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 31years old.  She is married and the mother of a child who is currently in school. She is a very hard working woman and committed to her work. She prepares and sells pastries and food stuffs including doughnuts, peanuts and washing soaps, in her neighborhood. Her doughnuts are prepared from flour. Her pastry (doughnuts) is enjoyed by many. Theresa sometimes sells the through hawking. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. Theresa requests the loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine, washing soap and peanuts etc. to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy supplies flour, margarine, sugar, cooking oil, peanuts and washing soap etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client has applied to this microfinance institution for his fourth loan. He runs a small photo shop and has been in business for seven years. Over the years, he has expanded his shop and bought new equipment. This has helped him attract more customers to his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase cameras and upgrade fixtures and small equipment in his photo shop

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget, 43 years old and married with four children, has sold ladies' clothes at retail prices to her customers for a long time. Since this is the high season for her business, she hopes to meet the demands of her customers through a loan of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Bridget hopes to own a boutique in the future.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ladies' clothes to sell

loans.name: Ediri

texts.en: Ediri, 49 years old and married with three children, sells plastic items such as cups, bowls and plates to make a living. She is a friendly woman and she uses this skill to attract more customers to her stall. She has been in this business for a long time and is requesting  a loan of N100,000 to purchase more plastics to sell. Ediri says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is married with eight children and she is 40 years old. Her husband works in a private firm in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She is a hardworking woman, selling foodstuffs like rice, beans, tomato paste and noodles.

Felicia is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to be a major foodstuff distributor in future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Philo

texts.en:
Philo is 30 years old and she is married with a child. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells groceries and she hopes to expand her business. She is happy because the high season is here and her sales will increase. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers.

She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 38 years old and she is married with six children. She is a commercial tailor and she also sells tailoring materials and sarongs of various colors to her customers. Stella hopes to be a big designer in the future.

This is the high season for Stella’s business and she hopes to make more profits. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 65 years old, is married, and is a mother with six children. One of her kids is in school and the rest of the children are grownups.

To support her household, Adwoa buys and sells cereals like local maize in the community market to her loyal customers. She has been in business for seven years now. She says the selling of this product is very lucrative.

Adwoa takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her make a good income to support her family, especially for their education. She hopes to repay the loan on time so that she can access a new one.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like rice

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 47 years old, is married, and is the father of five children, all of whom are in school. Solomon, as he is popularly called, is very hardworking and dedicated to his business. For him to be focused and stable he has to shun unnecessary things that retard his family and his business growth.

In taking care of his family, Solomon deals in video, audio music, and movie discs, a business he has done for twelve years. He also sells polythene (polyethylene) bags to augment his profit. He buys stock from Nigeria and spends almost a week or two before he returns to Ghana.

Solomon dreams of expanding his business by renting a store so that he can stock his shop to attract customers. He would be grateful for your assistance to realize this dream of his.

loans.use: To buy video discs, African movies, foreign movies, etc., in bulk

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46 years old, married, and the father of seven children. His firstborn has finished senior high school while the rest are still in school.

Charles is a very hardworking young man whose hard efforts contribute about 82% of his household income. He is a trader and, for twenty-one years, has traded in lace materials, shoes, slippers, textiles and dressing bags. He takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana and retails to the final consumers.

Charles requests the loan to augment his working capital to buy more stock of lace clothes, slippers and dressing bags to sell. He believes the loan will enable him to raise more income to support his children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothing materials, ladies bags and slippers

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is married and is a mother with five children. She is 30 years old and currently living with her husband and the children.

Georgina is a very hardworking woman and committed to her work. She prepares and sells pastries like doughnuts and meat pies in her neighborhood and flip-flops (sandals) and sachet mineral water (water in plastic bags) in a rented kiosk. The pastries are prepared from flour and are mostly purchased by her loyal customers. She treats her customers with care and combines the sale of pastries with the sale of flip-flops.

Georgina treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods, especially the flip-flops. She requests the loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine, etc., to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a stock of flour, margarine, cooking oil, slippers and sachet water in bulk

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is 28 years old. She is single and lives in a rented apartment with her sister.

To support her household, Afia has been hawking retail goods (going door-to-door). She trades in goods like cosmetics, clothes and slippers in her neighborhood to her loyal clients. She walks for very long distance to make sales but sometimes she does that by hiring a car to carry her goods.

Afia says selling these goods is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income for savings and business growth. With the loan she believes she can rent a store to trade her goods. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of cosmetics

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is 52 years old, is widowed, and is a mother with eight children, two of whom are currently in school.

Akua is very humble and committed to her work and to the family needs as a single mother. She sells smoked fish in bulk at the community market and started a year ago. She takes her stock of goods from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and retails to her customers.

Akua requests the loan to buy stock in bulk. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Ramon Alberto

texts.es: Ramón Alberto tiene la edad de 35 años, es un hombre casado. Ramón tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica es compra y venta de ropa. El  dio inicio este negocio por que no tenía un trabajo, y su esposa y su hijo necesitaban el sustento diario, a pesar de lo difícil que es su situación Ramón mantiene la alegría con sus clientes. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y lo más difícil de su trabajo es que tiene que recorrer muchos kilómetros en busca de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa interior, calzado entre otros. A pesar de los difíciles problemas que enfrenta como las cuentas por cobrar. Los sueños de Ramón son de proporcionarle a su familia las condiciones de vida necesarias.
texts.en:
Ramón Alberto is 35 and married. Ramón has two children. He buys and sells clothes. He started this business because he did not have work, and he needed to provide for his wife and son. In spite of how difficult Ramón’s situation is, Ramón is always cheerful with his customers. He has had this business for over six months. The most difficult thing about his work is having to travel so many kilometers looking for customers. In spite of the problems he faces like settling customer accounts, he will use the loan as working capital to buy underwear and footwear among other things. Ramon’s dreams are to give his family the living conditions that are a necessity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 49-year-old trader. She is married with three children, two of whom are currently in school while her last-born is still breastfeeding.

Ruth trades in Dumas (a brand name) clothes, linen and lace materials and has been in this business for the last ten years. Her major challenge over the years has been obtaining funds to scale up her business. She has amassed lots of marketing experience and she is very confident that the loan will enable her to make remarkable business progress.

Ruth wants to use the loan to buy more bales of Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials with variety to increase her inventory. She says her greatest joy would be when she is able to provide her kids with a quality education to make them more resourceful in future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Antonia del Carmen O. B. tiene la edad 54 años, ella tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de calzado. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que fue un inicio como una alternativa de fuente de ingresos para su familia. Por lo que atravesó dificultades para lograr tener este negocio, como fue la poca afluencia de clientes que ella poseía pero esto no la desanimo y cada dial icho por seguir adelante. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para capital que será destinado para la compra de sandalias, zapatos, entre otros productos. El sueño de Antonia es tener su propio establecimiento con un buen inventario para su negocio.
texts.en:
Antonia del Carmen O. B. is 54 years old and has four children. She sells footwear to make a living. She’s been doing this for more than 10 years, and she initially started this business to provide an alternative source of income for her family. She overcame difficulties to be able to have this business, such as the low inflow of customers that she had, but this did not discourage her and each day she continued forward. She asked for this loan so she can purchase sandals, shoes, and other products. Antonia’s dream is to have her own establishment with good inventory for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Providencia Group

texts.es:
Este unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama La Providencia porque asi se llama la comunidad en donde viven.  Las UDEs son grupos de más de 10 personas que tiene una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunir semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna.  La Providencia se encuentra en el estado de Veracruz.  El grupo está conformado por  15 integrantes.  

El representante del grupo se llama Luis Marcial C. H..  Luis Marcial es soltero, tiene 27 años, vive con su padre que es tambien es integrante del grupo y estudió hasta la Universidad.  Él se dedica a la venta de ropa deportiva como los tenis, pantalones y shorts y necesita el préstamo para comprar mas ropa y otras cosas deportivas.  El tiene un local fisico en el centro de su comunidad y por eso sus clientes son toda la gente que pasa por ahi. El decidio iniciar este negocio porque acaba de regresar de los Estados Unidos (Riverside, California) y un amigo le segurio este negocio. Su amigo no tenia el dinero para poder comenzar este negocio. Luis Marcial desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, ya que quiere en un futuro un local mas amplio o incluso en otra comunidad. Como presidente espera que todos los negocios de sus compañeros tengan exito.

Lucia V. C. es parte del comité de este grupo, La Providencia.  Ella tiene 30 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, y tiene 1 hijo.  Ella se dedica a la venta de jeans (levis), camisas, blusas y ropa en general para toda la familia y necesita el préstamo para comprar mas mercancia y comprar sandalias.  Sus clientes son sus vecinos, ella los visita casa por casa. Desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio y poder comprar muebles para su hogar propio.

Los otros 13 integrantes se llaman son:
JESUS C. G.-Equipo de sonido para su negocio de musica.
MERCEDES B. L.-Venta de refrescos.
ROSENDA L. B.-Venta de cosmeticos.
JOVITA H. L.-Venta de dulces.
SUSANA O. O.-Venta de velas aromaticas.
PILAR T. M.-Venta de calzado.
MARCOS L. C.-Venta de pollo.
MARIA ESTELA D. T.- Venta de calzado.
TERESA O. O.-Venta de ropa.
FRANCISCA A. R.- Venta de calzado.
ELENA C. M.- Venta de pollo.
VICTOR F. C.- Venta de ropa.
ROSALBA M. M.-Venta de dulces.
texts.en:
This Development Cooperative is called La Providencia because that is the name of the community in which they live. Development Cooperatives are groups of more than ten people who have a bank account and have to meet weekly or biweekly to make their payments. They have a representative and a governing committee. La Providencia is located in the state of Veracruz. The group is comprised of 15 members. Luis Marcial C. H. is the group’s representative. Luis Marcial is 27 and single. He lives with his father, who is also a member of the group. He has a high school education. He sells sports clothes like tennis shoes, pants, and shorts. He needs a loan to buy more clothes and other sporting goods. He has a fixed location in the center of his community. Therefore, his customers are all of the people that pass by that location. He decided to start this business when he had just returned from the United States (Riverside, California). A friend suggested this business. His friend did not have the money to be able to start this business. Luis Marcial wants this loan to expand his business. In the future, he would like a larger location or even one in another community. As the president, he hopes that all of the other businesses of his colleagues are successful. Lucia V. C. is part of the governing committee of this group, La Providencia. She is 30, has a middle school education, and has one child. She sells jeans (Levi’s), shirts, blouses, and general clothes for the whole family. She needs a loan to buy more merchandise and to buy sandals. Her customers are her neighbors. She visits them by going door to door. She wants this loan to expand her business and to be able to buy furniture for her own home. The other 13 member are: JESUS C. G.-Sound equipment for his music business MERCEDES B. L.-Sells refreshments ROSENDA L. B.-Sells cosmetics JOVITA H. L.-Sells sweets SUSANA O. O.-Sells scented candles PILAR T. M.-Sells footwear MARCOS L. C.-Sells chicken MARIA ESTELA D. T.- Sells footwear TERESA O. O.-Sells clothes FRANCISCA A. R.- Sells footwear ELENA C. M.- Sells chicken VICTOR F. C.- Sells clothes ROSALBA M. M.-Sells sweets

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El señor Humberto A. socio emprendedor y entusiasta, tiene 56 años D. edad, divorciado con  5 hijos mayores D. edad, su domicilio esta ubicado  en L. zona alta D. huaycan- distrito D.  Ate  departamento D.  Lima, trabajaba como obrero en una mina pero tuvo que dedicarse a otra actividad ya que L. mina en L. cual laboraba colapso y empezaron a realizar huelgas. 
Viene trabajando con Edaprospo- Prosperidad desD. hace 2 años, asume el cargo D. presidente D. L. alcancía comunal “Unión por el Progreso” L. cual esta  conformada por 11 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: reciclaje, venta D. ropa, venta D. comida, bodega y otros.
Humberto se dedica desD. hace 8 años a L. venta D. caldo D. gallina, el cual se encuentra ubicado a L. altura del ultimo paradero HGK - Huaycan. Con su reciente préstamo  planifica comprar una congeladora para conservar mejor sus insumos. Hasta el momento a logrado levantar las P. D.  su vivienda  con material noble (ladrillos) pero su anhelo es  terminar D. construirL. (techar, ponerle piso, etc.), para aperturar mas adelante una bodega.
texts.en:
Humberto A. is an enterprising and enthusiastic member. He is 56, divorced, and has five grown children. His house is located in the area of Alta Huaycan, Ate district, Lima department. He worked as a miner. He had to change to another activity because the mine in which he worked collapsed and they started strikes. He has been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for two years. He is the president of the Unión por el Progreso Communal Bank. The Communal Bank is comprised of 11 members who are engaged in different activities like recycling, selling clothes, selling food, and having a convenience store and other things. For eight years Humberto has been selling chicken soup. His business is located near the last HGK stop in Huaycan. With his recent loan he plans to buy a freezer to better preserve his supplies. Up until now he has been able to raise the walls on his house with decent material (bricks), but his goal is to finish building it (put on a roof, lay a floor, etc) in order to later open a convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer to better preserve his supplies

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Fuerza y Valor caracterizan a la señora Luz que ha luchado para sacar a sus hijos adelante.
Luz se dedica a alquilar sus 2 locales, desde hace 20 años, no es un trabajo agotador donde se invierte 8 horas diarias, pero si algunas horas a la semana, el resto de horas lo usa para estar tiempo con sus hijos, ayudarlos en sus tareas, jugar con ellos, y darles buenas lecciones de vida.
Ella con la ayuda de su esposo, que trabaja en una zapateria, ahorran para el mejoramiento de sus locales, y para terminar de construir su casa, solo le faltan algunos acabados.
Su mas grande sueño de Luz es ver a todos sus hijos profesionales, ella rie al imaginar a sus hijos con terno, pero sabe que estaran listo para la vida porque ella lo educara con amor y dedicación.
texts.en:
Strength and valor characterize Luz. She has fought to get her children ahead. Luz has rented out her two locations for 20 years. It is not exhausting work where she works eight hours daily. But, she does work some hours during the week. The rest of the time she uses to be with her children, help them with their homework, play with them, and give them good life lessons. With the help of her husband, who works in footwear, she saves to improve the locations and to finish building their house. It only lacks the finishings. Her biggest dream is to see her children become professionals. She laughs when she imagines her children wearing suits. But, she knows that they will be ready for life because she is educating them with love and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LAS MARAVILLAS”  se encuentra ubicada en la parte alta D. Huaycan distrito D. Ate departamento D. Lima, vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace unos 5 meses, la alcancía comunal esta  conformada por 9 socios quienes desempeñan diferentes tipos D. actividades como: producción, comercio y  servicio, la cual esta representado por: 
Alejandra R., quien asume el cargo D. Tesorera, tiene 35 años, madre soltera con 1 hijo D. 9 años. Alejandra se dedica  a la venta D. abarrotes desD. hace 9 meses, tiene una pequeña bodega en casa, su nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en surtir los productos D. su bodega, para  poder así  abastecer a sus clientes. También se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo desD. hace 3 meses, en el futuro anhela poder hacer crecer  su negocio.

María Santos, actualmente asume el cargo D. Secretaria, tiene 41 años, conviviente, con 4 hijos, Maria se dedica al negocio D. cerrajería y ventas D. productos D. ferretería desD. hace 10 años. Empezó en este negocio por la motivación D. su cuñado que la animo,  ya que por su zona no hay este tipo D. negocio, con su reciente préstamo lo invertirá  en la compra D. artículos tanto para la cerrajería y ferretería.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Maravillas" is located in the high part of Huaycan, in the Ate district of the Lima region. This group has been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for 5 months. The communal bank is comprised of 9 members who perform different types of activities such as production, traD. and services. The group is represented by Alejandra R., who is the Treasurer. She is 35 years old, and is the mother of a 9 year-old son. Alejandra has been selling groceries for 9 months; she has a small store in her house. Her new loan will be used to invest in products for her store, so that she can meet the needs of her customers. In addition, for 3 months she has been selling beauty products through a catalog. In the future she aspires to be able to increase her business. Maria Santos, who currently holds the title of Secretary, is 41 and lives with a partner and their 4 children. For 10 years Maria has had a locksmith business where she also sells hardware products. She started this business with the encouragement of her brother-in-law, since this type of business did not exist in her area. With her current loan, she will invest in the purchase of items such as locks and hardware.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for business

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Mujeres Forjadoras” se encuentra ubicada en la parte baja de Huaycan distrito de Ate departamento de Lima, representada por  Vilia Mirtha T., quien actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía,  tiene 45 años, con 3 hijos que depende exclusivamente de  ella .
La alcancía ha iniciado a trabajar con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace unos días, esta  conformada por 9 socios emprendedores quienes desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades en su mismo domicilio y en forma ambulante como: venta de comida y frituras, venta de ropa de vestir, venta de abarrotes, servicio de confecciones de polo, confección y venta de sabanas, crianza de porcinos, venta de productos de belleza y servicio de limpieza en hogares.
El destino del reciente préstamo será para la adquisición de mercadería para surtir sus productos e insumos y materiales para sus negocios. Sus expectativas son tener mayores ingresos para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, así como también tener una economía más estable para ir mejorando la educación de sus hijos. Los socios nos encontramos muy entusiasmados y agradecidos y de poder trabajar con la institución y nos comprometemos a no defraudarlos.
texts.en:
The communal savings group "Mujeres Forjadoras" (Women Forging Ahead) is located in the lower part of the Huaycan district in the Ate department of Lima and is represented by Vilia Mirtha T., who is the current president of the group. Vilia is 45 years-old and has 3 children that depend on her. The group started to work with EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad many years ago and is made up of 9 enterprising members who have various businesses in their homes and traveling, which are the sale of food and fried snacks, clothing, groceries, tailoring, manufacture and sale of sheets, the raising of pigs, the sale of beauty products, and a home cleaning service. The new funds from this loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise to stock up and to buy materials for later manufacturing. They hope with this loan to bring in mO. money in order to provide their families a better quality of life and also to have a mO. stable income in order to continue educating their children. We the members are very enthusiastic and grateful to be able to work with this institution, and promise not to disappoint you all.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise to stock businesses and materials for later elaboration

loans.name: Naty

texts.es:
Naty, de 31 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en la casa que su esposo le dejó cuando se divorciaron y lo que más desea es darles una buena vida a sus queridos hijos. 

El trabajo de Naty es la venta de materiales de construcción, ella abre su ferretería muy temprano por la mañana y es la principal distribuidora de su barrio, ya que no tiene competencia cercana. Sus vecinos siempre acuden a su ferretería cada vez que necesitan algo para la reparación de sus casas, además que saben que recibirán una buena atención.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de lo que sucede en su barrio, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los materiales de construcción hasta su ferretería. 
Para un futuro cercano desea modificar la infraestructura de su casa, para ampliar su ferretería.

Este es el primer préstamo de Naty con MFP y quiere acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, por eso está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. Con los 3000 soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales de construcción para implementar mejor su ferretería.
texts.en:
Naty, 31, is a very loving mother. She lives in the house that her husband left her when they divorced. What she wishes for most of all is to give her dear children a good life. Naty sells construction materials. She opens her hardware store very early in the morning. She is the main distributor in her neighborhood, and she does not have any competition nearby. Her neighbors always go to her hardware store each time they need something to repair their houses. Also, they know that they will receive good attention. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers and finding out what is happening in her neighborhood. She has been in this business for two years. The most difficult part is transporting the construction materials to her hardware store. In the near future she would like to modify the infrastructure of her house in order to expand her hardware store. This is Naty’s first loan with MFP. She would like access to subsequent loans. Therefore, she is prepared to make all of her payments punctually. She will use the 3,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy new construction materials to better set up her hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Deizi

texts.es:
Deizi, de 49 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en una habitación alquilada junto a sus 2 hijos: Fiorella de 20 y Gerson de 13 años y lo que más desea es darles una buena vida.

Su negocio es la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria, todos los días recorre las instituciones públicas y privadas en busca de clientes que deseen comprar algo de lo que vende. La ropa la trae de la ciudad de Lima, es por eso que los modelos que vende son muy novedosos y llamativos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que están de moda, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. 
Para más adelante espera tener el dinero suficiente para tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Deizi con MFP, está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre le pone mucha a alegría a las reuniones. Con los 1000 soles solicitados comprará más ropa en la ciudad de Lima para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad para escoger.
texts.en:
Deizi, 49, is a very happy woman. She lives in a rented home with her two children. Fiorella is 20, and Gerson is 13. What she wants most of all is to give them a good life. She makes her living as a street vendor selling clothes. Every day she goes to public and private institutions looking for customers who want to buy something that she is selling. She brings the clothes from the city of Lima. That is why the clothes she sells are very new and striking. What she likes most about her work is advising her customers about what clothes are in style. She has been doing this for 20 years. The most difficult part is having to walk all day looking for customers. Later she hopes to have enough money to have a store where she can sell more calmly. This is Deizi’s third loan with MFP. She is prepared to work very hard to make her payments on time. She is much loved in her communal bank. She always adds a lot of joy to the meetings. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more clothes in the city of Lima so that her customers can choose from a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, de 21 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a su querido hijo Yerson de 2 años, a quien desea dar una buena educación.

Aunque tuvo a su hijo muy joven, Maria no dejó que las necesidades de dinero que tenía la vencieran, es así que logro juntar un poco de dinero e implementar su propio negocio de comida. Ahora tiene muchos clientes, ya que sus deliciosos platos de papa con queso y papa con huevo, son muy solicitados y consumidos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, ella se esmera mucho en complacerlos, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo el ardiente sol todos los días. 
Para un futuro cercano espera poder comprar un carrito de comida donde pueda trasladar sus utensilios con mayor facilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Maria con MFP, se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, ya que es muy puntual. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
Maria, 21, is a very hard-working young woman. She lives in her family’s house together with her dear two year old son, Yerson. She wishes to give him a good education. Although she had a child when she was very young, Maria did not let her need for money defeat her. She was able to get together a little money and set up her own food business. Now she has lots of customers. Her delicious potato and cheese and potato and egg dishes are much asked for and consumed. What she likes best about her work is waiting on her customers. She takes great care in pleasing them. She has been doing this for three years. The most difficult part is having to stay under the burning sun everyday. In the near future she hopes to be able to buy a small food cart so that she will be able to move her utensils easier. This is Maria’s first loan with MFP. She is very happy to have the opportunity to have a loan. She is prepared to make all of her payments punctually. She is a much respected member of her communal bank because she is very punctual. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the food she makes

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés, de 46 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a su esposa Teodosia y sus 2 hijos: Norma de 15 y Christian de 13 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Todos los días, junto a su motocarro, Moisés sale en busca de clientes para transportar, su día comienza muy temprano por la mañana, ya que la experiencia de los años le ha demostrado que mientras más temprano trabaja, más dinero lleva a su hogar y se queda hasta altas horas de la noche, llegando sólo a su casa para dormir.
Aparte de trabajar con su motocarro, Moisés ha logrado implementar una carretilla de golosinas, la cual es atendida por su esposa, quien de esta forma contribuye con el sustento de su hogar.
Lo que más le gusta a Moisés de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros y hacerles más ameno el viaje, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar las noches frías de la ciudad de Juliaca. 
Para más adelante, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un nuevo motocarro con el cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Moisés con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo si no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido, ya que es el único varón. Con el dinero que ahora solicita hará arreglar los asientos de su motocarro, los cuales ya están muy gastados por el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Moisés, 46, is a very hard-working man. He lives in the house he inherited from his parents with his wife, Teodosia, and their two children. Norma is 15, and Christian is 13. They are the motivation for all of his efforts. Everyday, together with his “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle), Moisés leaves looking for customers to transport. His day starts very early in the morning. His years of experience have shown him that the earlier he works, the more money he will bring home. He works until late at night, arriving home only to sleep. Besides working with his motocarro, Moisés has set up a little cart with sweets. His wife tends the cart. This way she contributes to the support of the household. What Moisés likes the best about his work is talking to his passengers and making the trip more enjoyable. He has been doing this for 13 years. The most difficult part is having to endure the cold nights in the city of Juliaca. Later he hopes to get together the necessary money to buy a new motocarro with which he will be able to improve his income. This is his second loan with MFP. He knows that he has to pay it on time if he does not want to cause problems for the members of his communal bank. He is much loved in his communal bank; he is the only man. He will use the money he is now asking for to fix the seats in his motocarro. Because of the passage of time, they are very worn out.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the seats of his motocarro

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, de 31 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Felipe de 33 años, y ambos están muy esperanzados en formar una familia y para ello están dispuestos a trabajar muy duro.

Son 16 horas las que Paulina pasa dentro de su tienda, ya que abre a las 6 de la mañana y atiende durante todo el día, de corrido, hasta aproximadamente las 10 de la noche. Su bodega es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, ya que sus vecinos saben que ahí siempre encuentran lo que necesitan.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. 
Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Paulina con MFP, está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy respetada por la puntualidad que demuestra. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos para implementar mejor el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Paulina, 31, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 33 year old husband, Felipe. They are both very hopeful about forming a family. They are prepared to work very hard in order to do so. Paulina spends 16 hours in her store. She opens at six in the morning, and she tends the store all day, on the go, until approximately ten at night. Her convenience store is one of the busiest in her neighborhood. Her neighbors know that they will always find what they need there. What she likes most about her work is talking with her neighbors and finding out what is happening in her neighborhood. She has been doing this for five years. The most difficult part is having to stay in her store all day without being able to go outside. In time, she hopes her business grows and will be able to give her better income. This is Paulina’s first loan with MFP. She is prepared to work very hard to make her payments punctually. In her communal bank she is much respected for the punctuality that she demonstrates. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more products to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy es un joven de 23 años muy trabajador, vive en la casa que le cedieron sus tías a su mamá, a quien desea dar una buena vida. 

Su juventud no le ha impedido trabajar muy duro para llevar dinero a su casa, por el contrario ha sido su principal fortaleza, ya que trabaja cortando madera y vendiéndola como leña, esta actividad le ha dado el dinero suficiente para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y para poder comprarse una sierra eléctrica, la cual muestra orgulloso en la foto.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es plantar árboles, ya que cada vez que corta uno tiene que plantar otro en su lugar para que reemplace al que fue cortado. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cortar los árboles, ya que siempre hay el peligro de que caiga sobre alguien, por lo cual es muy cuidadoso al hacerlo. 
Para un futuro cercano, espera comprarse un pedazo de bosque donde pueda sacar madera sin tener que comprarla antes.

Este es el primer préstamo de Percy con MFP y está muy feliz por la oportunidad del crédito, por lo que está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy querido. Con el dinero solicitado comprará nuevos árboles para talar, ya que sus pedidos de madera han aumentado.
texts.en:
Percy is a 23-year old hardworking young man who lives in the house given to his mother by his aunt and uncle. They wanted Percy and his mother to have a good life. His youth hasn’t inhibited him from working hard to bring money home. On the contrary, it has been his strength since he cuts wood to sell as firewood. This work has given him enough money to help with the household expenses and to buy an electric saw. He shows it off proudly in the photo. What he likes most about his work is planting trees. Each time he cuts one down another has to be planted in the same spot to replace the original. He has been doing this work for two years. The most difficult part is the cutting down since there is always the danger that a tree will fall on someone. He is very careful. In the near future he is hoping to buy a small part of the woods where he can take out a tree without having to buy it first. This is the first loan for Percy with MFP and he is very happy to have the opportunity for credit. He is ready to pay back the installments on time and he is well-liked in his communal bank. With the money he would like to buy new trees to cut down since his requests for the firewood have increased. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more trees

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, de 45 años, es una mujer luchadora, vive en su casa propia y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de sobre salir en la vida.

En la urbanización Clorinda Mattos de Turner de la ciudad de Juliaca, Teresa tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable. Desde las 5 y 30 de la mañana abre su tienda de comestibles y se dispone a vender los productos que tiene en stock, esta actividad la realiza hasta las 10 de la noche que es la hora cuando cierra su tienda.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender, es muy buena vendedora, ya que siempre sus clientes salen muy contentos de su tienda. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su bodega, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. 
Para más adelante, espera mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo de Teresa con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 45, is a fighter. She lives in her own house and is ready to work very hard for the sake of getting ahead in life.

Teresa has her grocery shop in the Clorinda Mattos de Turner housing development in the city of Juliaca. She is very happy with her business since it is very profitable. She opens her food shop at 5:30 in the morning, ready to sell the products that she has in stock. She carries out this activity until 10:00 at night, which is the hour when she closes.

What she likes most about her work is selling. She is a very good saleswoman since her customers always leave her shop very satisfied. She has been in this business for 10 years and considers the most difficult part having to stay all day in the store without leaving to accomplish other things.

For the future, she hopes to improve her shop and make it grow in order to be able to better serve her customers. This is Teresa’s first loan with MFP. She hopes to be punctual with her payments since she doesn’t want to let down the rest of the members of her communal bank, where she is very well-liked and respected. With the 1000 soles applied for she will buy more products in order to improve her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta, de 58 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo menor, Edwin de 23 años, y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

Su trabajo es la venta de abarrotes de forma ambulatoria, ella recorre las ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca vendiendo leche, aceite, sacos de fideo, harina, etc. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y convincente, lo cual ha hecho que su negocio tenga muchos clientes y sus ingresos mejoren.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad de horarios que tiene, pues también tiene que velar por la seguridad de su hogar. Lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar sus productos hasta las distintas ferias de la ciudad. 
Para más adelante, desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender su mercadería con más tranquilidad, para ello está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Jacinta con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y promete hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy querida y respetada, ya que siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor el stock de su negocio.
texts.en:
Jacinta is a 58 year old loving mother who lives with her youngest son, Edwin, who is 23 years old. What Jacinta wants most is to live out her old age in peace. She is an ambulatory grocery saleswoman who goes from market to market in Juliaca selling milk, oil, sacks of pasta, flour, etc. She is a good humored and sincere saleswoman, which is why she has so many customers and earns good money. What she likes most about her work is the flexible schedule which allows her to take care of her home at the same time. She has been doing this for 16 years and finds the most difficult thing about it is transporting her goods to the various city markets. In the future, she would like to have a store where she could sell her merchandise with greater ease and she’s willing to work hard to achieve this.
