texts.en:
Dancilla M. is 40 years old, a widow with three children, and she takes care of two dependents with ages between 12 and 22 years old. Dancilla lives in Kicukiro district where she has owned a shop selling a mixed style of women’s shoes for the past eighteen years. Her business is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Dancilla is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through adding men’s shoes for sale in her business. She hopes that the savings from additional profits that are not reinvested will allow her to take care of her children, including her two dependents, through paying school fees and providing more food for them.

loans.use: To buy men's shoes to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 48 years old, married and has six children. She is a very happy woman, and uses her engaging personality to attract new customers to her stall in Warri, Delta state, where she makes a living selling colorful sarongs. Her goal is to be a major distributor of sarongs in her community. She has been in this business for a long time, and is applying for this loan to buy more sarongs to sell. She is doing well because the high season for her business has arrived, and business is good. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Kungu

texts.en:
Kungu is 47 years old, married and has three daughters. For the last five years, he has made a living as a tailor in Nairobi. When not working as a tailor, he earns extra money by transporting goods by handcart. He has applied for this loan to buy additional materials from which to make clothing.

Kungu is very focused and hardworking, and has been able to improve his business since joining Faulu. His goal for the future is to continue to improve his standard of living and become a well-established entrepreneur.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his business as a tailor.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 35 years old, has two children and runs a timber-supply business. He has been in this business for the last two years, and is applying for a loan to buy more timber to sell to his customers. He hopes to expand this business and also open a one-stop hardware store where his customers can get a wide range of building materials. He is doing well, and is committed to be even more successful in the future so that he and his family can live well.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 38 years old, married and has two children. She makes a living selling groceries such as corn flakes, juice and detergent. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket in her home town of Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time, and is applying for this loan to buy more groceries to sell. She extends her thanks to Kiva lenders for all their support.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.en:
A. Tohirjon is 30 years old, and is married with two children. Tohirjon has a middle special education and his specialization is engineering. However engineering salaries are small, and with this salary he has to feed his family and pay for his children's education, so he went into agrobusiness instead.

Tohirjon works hard to cultivate his products, such as potatoes, onions and carrots. He works from early morning till late at night in the hope of having a rich harvest. Tohirjon sells his products in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and expand his business. Today, Tohirjon is requesting a loan of $3000 USD to buy necessary materials for saving his products because he wants to sell them later when the price for them will increase. Let's help Tohirjon as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for saving his products

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia sells tailoring materials and sarongs. She is also a commercial tailor and makes beautiful clothes for her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 38 years old and married with three children.

This is the high season for Felicia’s business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
B. Sherali is 27 years old, married and has two children. He is a hardworking man struggling to feed his children and his parents who also live with him.

Sherali makes a living by selling the fabrics to make national dresses, and he has a trading place in the central local market of Istaravshan city. Sherali is trying to offer a wide range of goods in order to meet his customers' requirements and to satisfy the needs of customers with different levels of income. Being a devoted father, Sherali is doing his best in order for his children to be well educated and happy.

Today, Sherali feels that with more working capital his business could generate more income. He is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to jumpstart the business and raise his family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible father give his children a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Gairat

texts.en:
K. Gairat is 33 years old, married and has four children. His role as a father, which he has carried out for ten years, has helped him to understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house.

Gairat works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. He has grown and sold apples for more than five years. Gairat dreams that all of his children will be well educated and have a bright future – that is why he works from early morning till late at night.

Gairat wants to borrow $2,500 USD to buy apples and necessary supplies for saving his products because he wants to sell them later when the price for them will increase. This loan request is to make Gairat's dream come true, and he is asking for help from your generous heart.

loans.use: To purchase apples and necessary supplies for saving his products

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 52 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still in school. She operates Wajudys Wedding Gifts shop, selling utensils like sufurias (pots) and kettles, and beauty products like earrings, necklaces and flowers in wholesale. Her shop is located in Githiga Shopping Centre in Kiambu and she says it is unique because there are no other shops there like it. She has run her shop for six years and also earns extra income as a dairy farmer. Susan is requesting a loan of Kes 40,000 to add stock, especially jewelry, because December is wedding season in Kenya. Susan describes herself as a very hardworking lady who is focussed and works with a lot of seriousness. In the future, she hopes to expand both her businesses by partnering with Faulu, which she says she knows is a daraja (bridge) to making her dream come true. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of wedding items

loans.name: Favour

texts.en:
Favour is 38 years old and is married with three children. She sells drinks and juice at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time.

This is the high season for Favour’s business and she is determined to make more profits. She hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more juice and drinks to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: This is Carmelita C., 47 years old, from Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila. Her husband. Pedro, 47, is a vendor and they have three children. Carmelita has a general store situated just in front of her house. In front of the store, she also sells fish balls. She has been enjoying her business for the last six years and now earns P16,000 a month. From profits that she has been saving, she was able to retrieve a piece of land which was used as loan collateral to a loan shark. Carmelita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She applied for a new loan of P10,000 which she will use to buy more items to sell at her store, including non-perishable grocery items. In the future, Carmelita wants to see her general store become bigger than it is now. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To re-stock on grocery items for sale

loans.name: Benadetta

texts.en: Benadetta is 35 years old and married with four children aged 14 to 21. She has run a retail shop for the past seven years and sells unga (flour), fat, rice and other consumables. Benadetta is requesting a loan of Kes 40,000 to increase her inventory. In the future, she hopes to expand her business in order to better provide for her family and to eventually open a wholesale outlet. She describes herself as confident and determined. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of fat, rice and sugar

loans.name: Buston

texts.en: O. Buston is 49 years old and is married with three children. He has a large and friendly family who always try to help each other. Buston is a market vendor and his wife (pictured) is also engaged to this business. Buston wishes his children to get a good education, thus, allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future - this is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile. Buston sells women’s and men’s socks in the local market of Istaravshan. With over seven years of working at the market, Buston already has got enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him. In order to grow his business, as his children are growing up and accordingly their expenses are rising, Buston is requesting a loan of 3000 USD, which he will use to purchase merchandise to be able to offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. The well-being of Buston’s family and his business are in your hands. Buston and his family are sincerely grateful for your support. loans.use: To purchase  new goods to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate, 40 years old and the mother of five children, lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria, where she is married to a man who sells planks. Kate has sold utensils, including cooking pots and coolers, for a long time and eventually hopes to become a distributor of utensils in her community. Kate is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more utensils to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is 29 years old and the single mother of an eleven-year-old daughter called Margaret. For the past four years, Pauline has sold clothes to neighbours, friends, colleagues, and newcomers. She previously worked for a domestic service. She is requesting her second loan for Kes 30,000 to increase her stock. Pauline says that, since she became a member of Faulu, she has managed to pay her child’s school fees and improve her standard of living. In the future, she also hopes to further her own education and own a home. Pauline also provides counseling in her community and describes herself as having a passion for empowering the underprivileged in society. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Natalie

texts.en:
Natalie C., 31 years old, is a young widow living with her two children, both grade school students, in Maricaban, Pasay City. Natalie owns a general store which she opened two years ago. Life was been hard since her husband passed away, as she now stands as both mother and father to her two children. Thanks to her faith and perseverance, her general store is growing steadily despite stiff competition from other stores in the community. Because of high demand, she has also ventured into prepaid electronic load credits for mobile phones. Business is brisk and she usually makes at least P8,000.00 a month.

Natalie devotes much of her time attending to her business to help her in her grief over the passing of her husband, and she also finds time to attend gatherings for women entrepreneurs organized by the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2007.

She is now applying for a loan in the amount of P10,000.00 to buy more grocery items for her store. Natalie dreams of having a larger grocery store and a house and lot for her and her children. She also hopes to retail rice.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Daler

texts.en: This is Daler, who is an animated guy filled with enthusiasm. He works hard preparing and selling the national pie called “sambusa” (it is the flour course with the meat that is baked in the coals according to the old recipes) in a small place which he rents. Since he was very young, Daler learned a great deal about sambusa preparation from his mother and that's why he decided to dedicate himself to this work. Daler has big plans and dreams to grow his business. His goal is to have his own place where he can offer more comforts to his customers. And he'd like to buy a refrigerator so he can begin to offer cold drinks as well. With this purpose in mind, Daler wants to take a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase the necessary ingredients for preparing sambusa and also to improve his business conditions. He is very motivated to grow his business and increase his income. With his efforts and your important contribution, Daler can reach his goals. loans.use: To purchase ingredients for preparing sambusa and to improve his business conditions

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 32-year-old dressmaker. She is married, with two school-age children: a son and a daughter. She operates Roden Fashion, offering tailoring and design. She has run her business for three years and employs one person. She is requesting Kes 20,000 to increase her inventory. Rose describes herself as hardworking and committed and would like to have a big fashion firm in the future. Since joining Faulu, she says that she has learned the fundamentals of business. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of fabric

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: This is Lourdes G., a 59-year-old widow from Pasay City. She now lives with her nine children, one of whom studies in college. Lourdes is a fruit dealer. She supplies different fruit varieties to at least ten fruit vendors scattered across the city. She also retails her fruit in bus stations and busy streets in large plastic baskets. She has been in business for twenty-two years. Lourdes also runs a small eatery. She enjoys what she does, especially that her usual monthly earnings of P27,000 help her a lot in pursuing her child’s college education. She is also able to provide the basic daily needs of her big family. She only laments that she sometimes gets into trouble when some of her vendors are unable to remit their payments on time. In 2005, Lourdes joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She is now on her 15th loan and expects to receive a new loan in the amount of P34,000 as additional capital to buy more fruit. Lourdes dreams of a new house and lot for her family. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: Problems and money shortages never defeated Barno, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. She is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 32 years old, married, and the loving mother of three children. For more than 6 years, Barno has operated a store where she sells women’s clothing. As a rule she travels to the neighboring town to get new garments at very cheap prices. Her store is well known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful. Barno hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. She promises to repay the loan with accuracy as she has done with previous loans. Be an important part of the growth of Barno’s business. loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women in order to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: This is Apolonia D., a 40 year old transport operator from Munting Ilog, Silang, Cavite. She is married to Nelson, 45, a jeepney driver. They have three children, two of whom are in college and the youngest is in high school. Apolonia manages the operation of their passenger jeepney (a small bus) which her husband drives daily. It plies the routes covering the towns between Silang in Cavite and Zapote in Las Piñas City. They bought the jeepney, and acquired a permit for public conveyance, five years ago. Apolonia earns P21,000 a month from the jeepney’s operation and most of the profits go to her children’s education. She only laments that her husband finds it hard to convey passengers during rainy days because of heavy vehicle traffic. Apolonia considers her membership with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative a heaven-sent blessing. She wants to share with her friends the many blessings she has received since joining CCT. She is currently in need of a loan of P10,000 to be able to purchase much needed spare parts for the repair and improvement of their jeepney. She believes that their jeepney is God’s gift to them, enabling them to pursue their children’s education. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her jeepney

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: This is Rufina S., 46 years old, a preacher's wife from Silang, Cavite. All their four children are in different school levels. Rufina started her scrap metal buying business three years ago. She began small. She bought all kinds of used metals and even glass bottles and sold them to bigger buyers who in turn sold them to foundries. She makes P36,000 a month. Rufina thanks God for finding the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. With the loans she received, her business grew steadily. She is now in need of a P10,000 loan as additional capital for her junk shop business. She prays for God's provision so she can handle her children's education. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en: This is Irenea B., 51 years old, who lives and does business in Silang, Cavite. She lives with her husband Ignacio, a farmer, and their four children. Irenea has been selling vegetables for twenty-seven years and has also established a general store. She earns P27,000 a month which she saves for future needs. Her earnings answer for her family’s basic daily needs. Irenea is thankful for becoming a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She is now on her 7th loan. She is expecting a new loan from the cooperative of P16,000 as additional capital. With this fresh additional capital, she can purchase more assorted vegetables for her business. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more assorted vegetables

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
N. Sarah is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a friendly and hardworking lady who is married with four children, the eldest aged 15 years. She also takes care of one sibling.

Sarah has a retail shop in Salama that she has been running for some time now. She is happy that, through using loans, she is able to make considerable profits through the increased stock. She has been successful because she is able to treat her customers well.

In future, Sarah wishes for the shop to expand more so that paying her children’s school fees is no trouble. She needs a loan to be able to boost her business so that she can make more profits from it.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Deonila

texts.en: Deonila G. lives with her husband, Genaro, and their six children in Tala, Caloocan City. She is 59 years old. Deonila has been in business for fifteen years already. She manages her own sari-sari (general) store located at their house. On a daily basis, she makes P1,300. She saves most of her profits to answer for their basic daily needs. Last year, Deonila came to know about the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative and eventually became a member. She enjoys attending its weekly meetings for women entrepreneurs. Deonila has applied for a new loan with the cooperative in the amount of P18,000 as additional capital for her store. This will be her 6th loan. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: This is Lorna G., a 39-year-old store owner from Malaria, Caloocan City. She has four children, all going to school and her husband, Arbi, 40, is a mechanic. Lorna has been in business for six years already, managing her own sari-sari (general) store located at their house. On a daily basis, she makes P2,000 and saves most of her profits for the education of her children. Last year, Lorna came to know about the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative and eventually became a member. She enjoys attending its weekly meetings for women entrepreneurs. Lorna has applied for a new loan of P12,000 with the cooperative as additional capital for her store. Lorna looks forward to improving her general store into a grocery store outlet someday. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
N. Faridah is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 35 years old and a very hardworking lady.

Faridah has a charcoal-selling business that she has owned for eight years now in Kito village. She usually buys her charcoal in bags from the villages and loads them on a truck to her selling place. She is happy that the loans have always helped her manage her business. She is a friendly lady and this has won her many customers, hence making more sales.

Faridah hopes to expand her business in future so that her standard of living improves. She is a married lady with six children aged 15 years to 1 month and she takes care of other orphans including paying their school fees. She needs a loan to help introduce another business selling firewood, so that she can make more profits.

loans.use: To buy firewood for business expansion

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina M., 52, is a widow who lives with her three children in Ascoville, Tala, Caloocan City.

Angelina is an all-around beautician and runs a small beauty salon in the comfort of her home. Upon the request of customers, she also provides home service doing manicure, pedicure, haircut, hairdressing and make-up. She also sells cosmetics offered by direct selling companies like Avon and Sara Lee. She has been enjoying this kind of work for the last fifteen years and she now earns close to P13,000 a month. She uses her earnings to answer for her family’s daily needs.

Angelina joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007 and is now on her 11th loan. She has recently applied for a new loan in the amount of P20,000. She will use the funds to purchase supplies for her parlor/salon.


About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her salon/parlor

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna N. is a 58-year-old widow who lives with her eight children in Caloocan City. Lorna has been tending her general store for twenty-seven years now. She also cooks and sells food and is earning more than P14,000 a month. Much of her profits goes to her grandsons’ needs, but she also saves for herself. Lorna has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for four years and the loans provided by the cooperative help her pursue her business. She is now on her 12th loan and has applied for a new loan of P20,000 as additional capital. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: This is Leonora S., a 35 year old store owner. She lives with her husband and five children in Camarin, Caloocan City. Leonora owns and manages a variety (general) store. Beside it is her husband’s barber shop which she also manages. They’ve been in business for five years. The barber shop earns P10,000 a month while her store makes P14,000 monthly, enough to sustain their family’s basic daily needs. Leonora is applying for a new loan of P16,000 with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative as additional capital to purchase goods to sell at her store. It has been Leonora’s long sought-after dream to have a grocery store of her own. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Hannington's Group

texts.en:
S. Hannington is a 28-year-old determined hardworking and strong man who sells shoes and has a hardware shop. Hannington is the father of two children, ages 4 and 7 years old. His main business challenge is having limited capital but, otherwise, his business is doing well. He ensures that he has enough stock for his business. His dream is to build rentals as well as to educate his children to the university level. He needs a loan to help restock his hardware shop with more goods and to buy more shoes for resale.
S. Hannington is the leader of his group in Mukono.

loans.use: To buy more hardware products and shoes for resale

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia M. G., reside en el pueblo de Santiago Nonualco del departamento de La Paz. Marta es madre soltera, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su madre y sus dos hijos menores de edad y estudiantes. El no haber cursado sus estudios hacen para Marta una tarea mas difícil de buscar empleo, ya que El Salvador es un país muy pequeño al igual que sus oportunidades de empleo, es por ello que la única alternativa que Marta visualizo para sacar adelante a sus hijos y apoyar a su madre, fue iniciar su propio negocio una venta de comida y pupusas,  por el cual ahora solicita de un crédito que le permita aumentar su producción por medio de insumos, que comprara gracias a tu préstamo.
texts.en:
Marta Alicia M. G. lives in the town of Santiago Nonualco in the La Paz department. Marta, 48, is a single mother. She lives with her mother and her two minor children. Her children go to school. Marta has a difficult time looking for work because she does not have an education. El Salvador is a very small country, and its employment opportunities are also small. That is why the only alternative that Marta saw to get her children ahead and support her mother was to start her own business. She sells food and “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables). She is now asking for a loan that will allow her to increase her production. She will buy supplies thanks to the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 23 years old, married and blessed with four children. She operates a cereal business located at Mbururu in Eldoret. She was introduced to KADET by existing group members. She has applied for a loan which she intends to use to buy maize stock. Her dreams are to buy land and build a house where her family can settle.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Catherine Nafula

texts.en:
Catherine M. operates a cereal business. She buys cereals from different farmers and sells them at a profit. Catherine is 32 years old, married and has been blessed with seven children. Her business is located at Kona in Eldoret. She was introduced to KADET by a neighbour who was a client. She has applied for a loan which she intends to use to buy more maize stock. Her dreams for the future are to improve her business and further educate her children.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Joseph Shikuku

texts.en: Joseph is a 36-year-old businessman who runs a retail shop in Eldoret town near Lusweti primary school. He sells different consumer goods like cooking fat, soap, sugar, rice, soft drinks and other items. Joseph heard about KADET and he went to find out more by himself. After meeting with the KADET officers he decided to join as a member of an existing group. Joseph has since applied for a loan which he intends to use to add more stock in his retail shop. His future plans are to expand his business into a supermarket and create employment opportunities for his relatives. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add stock like cooking fat, rice and sugar

loans.name: Tonny's Group

texts.en:
O. Tonny is the leader of his lending group in Mukono.

Tonny is a 38-year-old man, determined and hard working, with a business of selling shoes from Nakawa central market. He has had the business for two years now and he is grateful that at least he is able to make 80,000/= as profits a week. He sells mostly men’s shoes and his business challenge is the high tax and the rent for his business.

At the moment, Tonny sells in small quantities but he would like to increase his stock by buying in bulk. He also wants to build his own house and stop renting for comfort and increased savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: María Dina Magdalena

texts.es: María Dina Magdalena R. de 47 años de edad reside en Tecoluca en el departamento de San Vicente. María vive con su esposo y su hija de 11 años de edad estudiante de básica, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora apoya a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor de granos básicos, hace cinco años María se dedica a su negocio el cual se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, donde vende refrescos, antojitos, tortillas y verduras; ahora solicita de un crédito para comprar leña, maíz y otros productos de los cuales ofrece.
texts.en:
María Dina Magdalena R., 47, lives in Tecoluca in the San Vicente department. María lives with her husband and their 11 year old daughter. Their daughter attends elementary school. María is a very hard-working woman. She helps her husband. He is a farmer and grows basic grains. María has worked for five years in her business, which is located in her home. She sells soft drinks, appetizers or snacks, tortillas, and vegetables. She is now asking for a loan to buy wood, corn, and other products that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Basilia Justa

texts.es: Doña Basilia B. tiene 65 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su esposo  e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 15 años de elaborar  Cortes Típicos en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chuisacmalja, del Cantón Xolsacmalja del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Basilia B., 65, is married. She works as a weaver making typical skirts for women. She has a shop with two looms. She lives with her husband and children. She and her husband do the same work, and they have two employees to help with the work. For 15 years she has been making typical skirts in her home, which is in the Paraje Chuisacmalja in the Cantón Xolsacmalja, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand has grown, but the economic conditions in which she finds herself are not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw materials to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to get her family ahead so they can have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials for making typical skirts

loans.name: Juan Daniel

texts.es: El señor  Juan T.  tiene 34 años de edad, es Casado Presta sus servicios,   habita junto  a su esposa  e hijos, su residencia que se encuentra en el Sector 2 Cantón Chuixchimal, del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente Por la necesidad de poder de comprar un vehículo, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para Cubrir su Compra, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan T. is 34 and married. He offers his services. He lives with his wife and children. His home is located in Sector 2 Cantón Chuixchimal in the department and municipality of Totonicapán, Guatemala. He currently needs to be able to buy a vehicle, but the economic conditions in which he finds himself are not sufficient to cover the cost. That is why he came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. He will buy raw material to be able to increase his sales. He is also hoping to get his family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a vehicle

loans.name: Natividad Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Natividad R. tiene 43 años de edad, es Casada de oficios de artesanía,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos” cuenta con tres telares, habita junto  a su Esposo, y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 14  años de elaborar en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chorajche, del cantón Pasajoc del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Natividad R., 43, is married. She makes typical skirts, and she has three looms. She lives with her husband. They both do the same work, and they have two employees to help them with the work. For 14 years she has been making skirts in her home, which is locted in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which she finds herself is not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw material to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to get her family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make typical skirts

loans.name: Minnie Waruiru

texts.en:
Minnie Waruiru is a 34 year old single mother. She has three daughters named Mary, Penninah (13 years) and Esther (two years old). She has been operating a general retail shop for the past four years. Minnie was introduced to KADET by a credit officer who was doing marketing outreach. She has previously accessed two loans which she repaid on time. She is now applying for her third loan which she is planning to use to add stock, such as foodstuffs and other goods, in her shop in time for the festive Christmas season. Minnie plans to build her own house on her own farm with the extra profit generated from the business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a supermarket. Minnie describes herself as a hardworking lady and a humble people person.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and goods for resale

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: Doña María Menchú tiene 24 años de edad, es casada de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un pequeño Taller, llevan  tiempo ya  de Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Chuisacmalja del  Cantón Xolsacmalja, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
María Menchú, 24, is married. She is a weaver, and she makes typical skirts. She lives with her husband. They both do the same work, and they have a small shop. They have been making skirts for some time. Their home is locted in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which she finds herself is not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw material to be able to increase their sales. She is also hoping to get her family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make typical skirts

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase K. is 35 years old and is married with four children aged between 4 and 12. Anastase lives in the Gasabo district where he owns a butcher shop. This is his sixth year of successful operation in business! The hours of his business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Although Anastase has been in the butcher business since 2003, his capital reserves are still too low to adequately satisfy the product needs and wants of his customers. He believes that a certain amount of additional capital to grow his business would allow him to offer more product and better quality.

For that reason, Anastase is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders to be able to purchase more weight of meats for sale which will bring him more revenue and, hopefully, more profit as well.

With this loan, and a successful business strategy, Anastase hopes to build a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To buy a cow to slaughter

loans.name: Israel Feliciano

texts.es: Doña María Menchú tiene 42 años de edad, es casada de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un pequeño Taller, llevan  tiempo ya  de Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Caserío Chotacaj del  la Aldea V. , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Israel Feliciano S. V. 42, is married. He is a weaver, and he makes typical skirts. He lives with his wife. They both do the same work, and they have a small shop. They have been making skirts for some time. Their home is located in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which he finds himself is not sufficient to increase his capital. That is why he came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. He will buy raw material to be able to increase his sales. He is also hoping to get his family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make typical skirts

loans.name: José Darvin

texts.es: Don José T. tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos”, habita junto  con su familia, ella y su familia se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un pequeño Taller, llevan  tiempo ya  de Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Chibatz del  Cantón Xolsacmalja, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José T. is 24 and single. He is a weaver, and he makes typical skirts. He lives with his family. He and his family do the same work, and they have a small shop. They have been making skirts for some time. Their home is locted in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which he finds himself is not sufficient to increase his capital. That is why he came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. He will buy raw material to be able to increase his sales. He is also hoping to get his family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make typical skirts

loans.name: Sepriano's Group

texts.en:
S. Sepriano has a retail shop business in Namugongo that he has been running for some time now. He is able to make 80,000/= a week as profit from his sales. He is 43 years old and married with three children and he takes care of one sibling.

Sepriano is a friendly, hardworking and determined man and the leader of his lending group. He ensures that he has the right stock for his customers hence making more sales in a day. He hopes to expand his business further and ensure that he gets necessary items for his family. Sepriano’s loans have helped him pay school fees for his children as well as enabled him to save for future developments. He needs a loan to help restock his shop with more goods for resale.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise B. is 33 years old and is married with five children and two dependents aged between 8 and 15 years. Francoise lives in the Gasabo district, in the capital city of Kigali where she owns a restaurant. She has been in business since 2004 in this location. She employs six people in her business and work begins at 5 a.m. and ends at 10 p.m. every day.

Francoise is a proven restaurant operator and is ready to expand her business meaningfully. She believes that a small amount of additional capital would allow her to do this. More modern kitchen equipment and a larger quantity of food at lower prices are among the intended uses of the proceeds.

To do this, Francoise is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. She expects this will add to her profits as it will allow her to operate more efficiently as well as to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and kitchen equipment

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es: Doña María V. tiene 56 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un pequeño Taller, llevan  tiempo ya  de Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el  Caserío Chotacaj de la  Aldea V., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María Vásques is 56 and married. She is a weaver, and she makes typical skirts. She lives with her husband. She and her husband do the same work, and they have a small shop. They have been weaving for some time. Their home is locted in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which she finds herself is not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw material to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to get his family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make typical skirts

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Doña Santos L. tiene 36 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un  Taller, llevan  tiempo ya  de Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el  Caserío Chotacaj de la  Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos L. is 36 and married. She is a weaver, and she makes typical skirts. She lives with her husband. She and her husband do the same work, and they have a shop. They have been weaving for some time. Their home is located in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which she finds herself is not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw material to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to get her family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make typical skirts

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 31 years old and is married with five children, their ages ranging between 5 and 14 years old. Florence lives in the Kicukiro district which is in the capital city of Kigali.

Florence has a shop where she sells a variety of dishes and kitchen products located in this area. She has been in the business of selling housewares for the past five years. However, she is a relatively new entrepreneur, having been in business for herself for only one year. Florence has a helper who works with her in the shop from seven in the morning until six at night.

Florence is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing a variety of attractive dishes in order to attract more customers and please her current ones. If successful, this will result in greater profits which she will likely reinvest in the business as well as take care of her children and begin to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of attractive dishes and home products

loans.name: Teresa Soledad

texts.es: La joven Teresa P. tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera de oficios comerciante,  “Venta de Dulces y algodones”, habita junto  con su familia, ella y su familia se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con una  máquina para hacer dulces, llevan  tiempo ya  de vender su residencia que se encuentra en el  Paraje Xeatzam, Cantón Nimapa, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa Pretzntzin is 23 and single. She sells sweets and cotton candy. She lives with her family. She and her family do the same work. They have a machine to make sweets, and they have been selling for some time. Her home is located in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which she finds herself is not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw material to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to get his family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando L. de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, María de 11 años , Karla de 8 años y Stefanni de 4 años de edad. Hace quince años Fernando inicio su negocio, tras muchos años de experiencias ganados trabajando en el oficio de carpintero. Es así como ahora maneja su propia carpintería donde le apoya su esposa y una sobrina, Fernando elabora variedad de muebles en madera para luego ser lucidos a las afuera de su negocio, donde muchos clientes le visitan. El destino del crédito que solicita Fernando, es para comprar un material el cual le están vendiendo a buen precio, así obtendrá mayores ganancias de los productos que comercialice.
texts.en:
Fernando L., 53 years old, lives with his wife and their three children, María, 11; Karla, 8; and Stefanni, 4. Fifteen years ago, Fernando started his business after many years of prior experience in the field of carpentry. Today, he owns and manages his own carpentry shop with the help of his wife and a niece. Fernando makes a variety of wooden furniture, which are then displayed outside his shop where many customers visit. This loan will be used to buy materials, which are now available at a good price. This will allow better profits on the products he makes.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for carpentry shop

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
N. Rebecca is into the business of stone quarrying. She is a 30-year-old lady and divorced with four children between the ages of 6 and 13. All her children are in school. She has been operating her business for seven years and she is able to make 50,000/= in weekly profits.

Rebecca is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She works very hard to ensure that she pays her children’s school fees on time and provides the basic necessities. She has a dream of building her own house as well as educating her children to university level so that they can find better jobs. She needs a loan to help buy space for stone quarrying so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy space for stone quarrying

loans.name: Ubaldo Miguel

texts.es: Don Ubaldo A. tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero de oficio Artesano,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos”, habita junto  con su familia, ella y su familia se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un  Taller, llevan 6 años en  Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el  Caserío Chotacaj de la  Aldea V., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Don Ubaldo A. is 26 years old and single. He and his family make traditional skirts. He has been weaving for 6 years out of a workshop in his home, located in the village of Chotacaj de la Aldea V. in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. The current demand from his customers has grown, but the economic conditions are not suitable for Don Ubaldo to raise more capital. For this reason, he has approached Asociación ASDIR for a loan. He will purchase raw materials so that he can increase his sales. He also hopes to move his family forward and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making traditional skirts

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi A. has been doing carpentry and joinery in Abotoase since 2006. He has received basic education. He is single and has no dependents, but he has the responsibility of taking care of his old and aged mother. His loan will be used to buy wood to make into furniture to sell. He hopes to reinvest the new profits in his business.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis O. is married and has six dependants. He has received schooling through junior high. Francis is a young entrepreneur who does furniture and other carpentry work in Abotoase, which he has done since 2004. Francis uses his income to finance the children's educational expenses and take care of the home single-handedly. Francis will use the loan to purchase wood to process into furniture for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Francis plans to reinvest.

loans.use: Francis will use the loan to purchase wood to process into furniture for sale.

loans.name: Ayitey

texts.en: Ayitey G. is single and has no dependants. He has received basic schooling. Ayitey is a young carpenter who has been constructing furniture in Abotoase since 2007. He uses his income to pay his utility bills and to feed himself. Ayitey will use the loan to purchase tools, equipment and wood to construct furniture to sell. With the profits from his expanded business, Ayitey plans to save.

loans.use: To purchase tools, equipment and wood

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr:
M. Moustapha T. est le propriétaire d'une boutique de vente et réparation de portables à Ouakam, Dakar.  
“Je suis dans l'électronic depuis le bas age, je répare des radios, téléviseurs et autres et c'est-ce qui m'a permis d'entrer dans le milieu de la vente et réparation de portables.”
Ce crédit est le cinquième prêt d'U-IMCEC pour M. T..  Avec le crédit, il voudrait acheter les nouveaux portables et accessoires pour bien satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.  Il est marié avec trois enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Moustapha T. is the owner of a shop selling and repairing mobile phones in Ouakam, Dakar. “I have been in electronics since I was young. I repair radios, televisions, and more. And this has enabled me to enter into the field of selling and repairing cell phones.” This loan is the fifth U-IMCEC loan for Mr. T.. With this loan, he would like to buy new cell phones and accessories to satisfy the demands of his customers well. He is married and has three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his stock of mobile phones an accessories

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
M. Ibrahima T. est un pécheur et commerçant à Ouakam, Dakar.  La péche est son activité principale, mais avec ce crédit il voudrait investir dans son activité secondaire: le commerce de tissus.  Il voudrait faire une mission au Mali, le pays voisin, pour chercher des tissus de hautes qualités, en particulier les Thioup (les tissus teintés).  Cette diversification de revenus, M. T. espére qu'il va lui permettre de survenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses six enfants.

Le poisson sur la photo est un exemple magnifique de Thiof – un poisson vraiment aimé par les senegalais.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima T. is a fisherman and a trader in Oukam, Dakar. Fishing is his main business but with the loan he would like to invest in fabric trading, his minor business. He would like to make a business trip to Mali, a neighboring country, to look for high quality fabrics especially 'Thioup' (tye and dye fabrics). Mr. T. hopes that this diversification of income will enable him to provide for the needs of his wife and six children. The photo of the fish is a magnificent example of Thiof, a fish that Senegalese really love.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics to diversify his income

loans.name: Ngone

texts.fr: Madame Ngone N. est un client d'UIMCEC depuis 2003.  Elle vend des détergents, les crèmes, les jus et autres produits à Baye Laye en Guediawaye, une banlieue au nord du Dakar.  Elle a plus de dix ans d'expérience dans le commerce, et quand elle était plus jeune elle faisait de missions en Gambie pour acheter les marchandises.  Avec son crédit, elle voudrait renforcer son stock des détergents mais aussi diversifier les tissus.  La veille de la fête de Tabaski va augmenter la demande pour de nouveaux habils et elle voudrait bien satisfaire la demande de son quartier.  Apres le revenu, elle voudrait renforcer ses épargnes à fin que son ambition d'aider son unique fils de 20 ans à réussir dans la vie soit réalisée.
texts.en:
Ms. Ngone N. has been a client of UIMCEC since 2003. She sells detergents, creams, juices, and other products, in Baye Laye en Guediawaye, a suburb in the north of Dakar. She has more than ten years of experience in commerce. And when she was younger, she used to go on missions to Gambia to buy merchandise. With her loan, she would like to bolster her inventory of detergents and also to diversify her fabrics. The eve of the Tabaski Festival will increase the demand for new clothing, and she would really like to meet the demand in her district. After increasing her revenues, she would like to boost her savings, so as to realize her ambition of helping her only child, aged 20, to succeed in life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy detergents and cloth to sell

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty O. is married and has six dependants. She has not received any formal education. Beauty has been selling maize in Abotoase for the past 6 years. Her husband is a carpenter with very little capital to care for the entire family. Beauty uses her income to feed her children and help her husband pay the housekeeping expenses. Beauty will use the loan to purchase other assorted grains for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beauty plans to save.

loans.use: To purchase other assorted grains for sale.

loans.name: Rotalia

texts.en:
Rotalia N. is single and has no dependants. She has received schooling through senior high.

Rotalia sells gari (roasted cassava), maize, rice beans and groundnuts (peanuts) in Abotoase, which she has done since 2006. She uses her income to pay for taking care of her financial needs, accommodation and the payment of utility bills.

With the high demand for the grains, she will use the loan to purchase a variety of the grains in large quantities for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grains in large quantities

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia es una persona soltera con 20 años de edad, vive en domicilio propio de un barrio humilde de su localidad. Lidia se dedica a la fabricación de codos y silletas de plástico, cuenta con cuatro años de experiencia en el rubro. La competencia es alta, ella tiene su propia clientela  ya que por la forma de atender  a sus clientes y principalmente la puntualidad en la entrega de productos es  de las preferidas. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de tubos  de plástico plasmar. Lidia cuenta con un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Lidia is a single person who is 20 years old, and lives in her own home in a modest neighborhood in her area. She makes plastic pieces for the construction sector. She has had 4 years of experience in this area, in which the competition is strong. She has her own clientele, since she takes care of her customers and delivers her products to them punctually, which is what they prefer. This loan will be used to purchase plastic tubes to shape. Lidia has a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy plastic tubes

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María vive en la casa de sus padres, no tiene hijos, es soltera y cuenta con 29 años de edad. Cuenta con la actividad de servicio de baño público con 4 años de experiencia en el rubro. Tiene bastante demanda y también cuenta con competencia ya que existen varios baños públicos que quedan ubicados en una avenida troncal de la provincia donde vive. El destino del crédito fue para capital de inversión, es decir para la adquisición de bienes y alimentos que servirán para la apertura del nuevo negocio de Ana María (negocio de comida). Cuenta con experiencia crediticia en Agrocapital y otra entidad financiera, este crédito es el tercero en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Ana Maria lives with her parents; she has no children, is single, and is 29 years old. She services public toilets, and has 4 years of experience in this line of work. There is sufficient demand, but also there is competition, since there are various public toilets that are located in the main avenue in the province where she lives. This loan was used for capital investment; that is, she bought different goods and foods to open another, new business selling food. She has experience with credit from Agrocapital and another financial entity; this loan is her third from our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital to open a new business selling food

loans.name: Justina Alberta

texts.es: Justina es una señora casada y cuenta con 47 años de edad, tiene su casa que es propia, donde vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas. Su actividad es la del el transporte por parte del esposo con 23 años de experiencia en el rubro, en la cual su esposa le ayuda en la administración de los ingresos. Tiene competencia porque el área de trabajo es una ciudad donde hay bastante movimiento y sobre todo vehicular. El destino del crédito fue para compra de equipo además de capital de inversión. Cuenta con buena experiencia crediticia en Agrocapital el presente préstamo es el cuarto en la institución.
texts.en:
Justina is 47 years old, and lives in her own home along with her husband and three daughters. Her husband has been in the transportation field for 23 years and she has helped him keep the books. They have competition because the area in which they work is a city where there is a lot of movement, particularly vehicular movement. This loan will be used to purchase equipment. She has a good credit history with “Agrocapital” and this will be her forth loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Equipment

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es: Agapito tiene 56 años de edad vive con su esposa e hijos que son jóvenes en su casa propia, Agapito junto a su esposa se dedican a la producción de mandiles, en este negocio tienen mucha experiencia y además de ser muy conocidos en el medio. Por otra parte, Agapito es músico en las fuerzas armadas y está en trámite para su jubilación anticipada.  La competencia es media ya que Agapito y su esposa entregan los productos a personas conocidas.  El destino del crédito fue para capital de operación, debido a que Agapito ha estado realizando construcciones en su casa por lo que se ha descapitalizado.  El comportamiento de Agapito es muy bueno ya que paga puntualmente  es su tercera secuencia, también trabaja con créditos institucionales. Finalmente, cabe mencionar que el cliente  ha demostrado durante este tiempo responsabilidad y buena fe pagos.
texts.en:
Agapito is 56 years old and lives in his own home, along with his wife and young children. Agapito and his wife make aprons. They are well known and are very experienced in this business. Agapito is also a musician in the armed forces and he is preparing for his retirement. They do not have much competition and Agapito and his wife deliver their goods to regular customers. This loan will be used as operating capital, as Agapito has had to make repairs to his home, which has depleted his savings. He has always been punctual in making payments, and this will be his third loan, also having worked with commercial lending institutions. He has always acted responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a 43-year-old married mother of four and a client of Asociación Arariwa.  Three of her children attend high school, while the other is in kindergarten.  Juana is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco.  The group is called El Amanecer, which means "daybreak" in Spanish.  Juana is from Cusco and lives there.

Juana has sold sticks, firewood, and logs from her house for the past 3 years.  She earns about 1,500 Peruvian soles (or about $526 US) each month.  She will use this loan to pay for her children's monthly school fees, as well as their food and school uniforms costs.

Juana appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To pay the monthly school fees for her children

loans.name: Franco Marcelo

texts.es: Franco vive en la casa de sus padres, es soltero, y cuenta con 21 años de edad. Cuenta con la actividad de elaboración de venta de hamburguesas y otros. Cuenta con demanda ya que vende en pleno centro de la ciudad debajo el puente de la calle 1 (lugar de mucha afluencia de personas). Existe competencia ya que alrededor existen otros puestos de venta de hamburguesas. El destino del crédito fue para capital de operación y apertura de una pensión. Cuenta con experiencia crediticia en Agrocapital y otra entidad financiera, el presente préstamo es el cuarto en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Franco is 21 year-old, single, and lives in the home of his parents. He works making and selling hamburgers and other products, and has steady business, as he sells the food items under the bridge of Calle 1 (a place with lots of pedestrian traffic). There is competition however, as around his spot there are other stands selling hamburgers. The funds from this loan will be used for working capital and the opening of a pension. Franco has experience working with Agrocapital as well as with another financial entity, and this loan would be the fourth with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital - opening of a pension account

loans.name: Valentin Cesar

texts.es: Valentín tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, tiene casa propia radica en ella desde hace 38 años, cuenta con 2 hijos. La actividad económica de Valentín se encuentra, en una feria que se ubica en el centro de la ciudad, Valentín cuenta con 19 años de experiencia en la comercialización de papa chuño y tunta. Su competencia es media, ya que el negocio se encuentra en un lugar estratégico que cuenta con demanda de clientes. El crédito fue para la compra de mercadería al por mayor papa, chuño y tunta. No tiene antecedentes negativos en ninguna de las centrales de riesgos.
texts.en:
Valentín is 38 years-old, married with two children, and has his own house which he has lived in for 38 years. Valentín's business is located in the central market of the city. Valentín has 19 years of experience selling potatoes, potato flour and dried potatoes. He has an average amount of competition as his business is located in a strategic location and has a strong demand from customers. The funds from this loan are for the purchase of potatoes, potato flour, and dried potatoes wholesale. He has no negative marks on his credit in any of the banking risk offices.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of merchandise (potatoes, potato flour, dried potatoes)

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: Eulogia es soltera con 28 años de edad, vive en el domicilio de su papa, no tiene hijos.
