Eulogia se dedica a la comercialización de compra y venta de carne de ovino (carne altiplano), cuenta con una experiencia de 6 años en el rubro. La competencia es alta, ella tiene su propia clientela  trabaja con los restaurantes y es principalmente por la puntualidad en la entrega de la mercadería que es una de las preferidas. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de  carne de ovino. Eulogia cuenta con buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Eulogia is 28 years-old, single with no children, and lives in the home of her father. Eulogia works buying and selling of sheep meat, (high plain meat), and has 6 years of experience in the area. There is a lot of compettion, but she has her own customers and works supplying restaurants. Her punctuality in supplying the meat has made her one of the preferred vendors. The funds from this loan will be used to buy sheep meat. Eulogia has a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep meat (operation capital)

loans.name: Americo

texts.en:
Americo is a 30-year-old father of two from Cusco who lives in Santiago.  He is a client of Asociación Arariwa, and is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco.  The group is called El Amanecer, which means "daybreak" in Spanish.

Americo sells quail eggs in the Molino market.  He will use this loan to buy more quails to raise and more feed to give them.  He buys his quails from Lima.  He makes approximately 80 Peruvian soles, or $30 US, a day.

Americo appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more quails to raise and food to feed them

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma, de 34 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en una habitación alquilada y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para salir adelante. 

El puesto de coches para niños de Irma está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable y tiene muchos clientes, quienes la buscan por los modelos novedosos que tienen sus coches.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva realizando esta actividad 8 años y considera que lo más difícil es traer los juguetes desde la ciudad de Tacna (al sur del Perú), ya que el viaje es muy largo y cansado, causando que pierda mucho tiempo en conseguir su mercadería. 
Para el futuro, espera instalar una tienda más grande donde pueda vender muchos más coches con más tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Irma con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable, siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más coches para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.	¿Qué es lo que comprará con este dinero?
texts.en:
Irma, 34 years-old, is a hard-working and happy woman who lives in a rented room and is ready to work hard to get ahead. Irma has a stand located in San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca) where she sells toy cars for children. She is very happy with her business as it is very profitable and she has a lot of customers who are attracted by the original designs of her cars. What she likes the most about her job is conversing with her neighbor vendors at the market. She has been in this business for 8 years and for her the hardest part is bringing the toys from the city of Tacna (southern Peru), as the journey is long and tiring, and causes a lot of lost time in obtaining the merchandise. In the future, Irma hopes to establish a larger store where she can sell many more cars more comfortably. This is Irma's first loan with MFP, but she knows she must pay on time and be ready to pay it back. In her communal bank she is very responsible and makes sure the other members adhere to their commitments. With the 1000 soles from this loan Irma will buy more toy cars to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of merchandise

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José María M. P. reside en Mejicanos municipio del departamento de San Salvador. José es un hombre soltero con 45 años de edad, vive junto su hermano y su sobrina de once años de edad. José y su hermano son muy unidos desde la muerte de su madre, ambos cuidan uno del otro, José ayuda a su hermano con las gastos del hogar y su sobrina, a quien él ve como una hija ya que juntos han criado a Joselin. José se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y caballeros, ahora el solicita de un crédito para poder invertir en mayor variedad de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
José María M. P. lives in the Mejicanos municipality in the San Salvador department. José is 45 and single. He lives with his brother and his 11 year old niece. José and his brother are very united since the death of their mother. They take care of each other. José helps his brother with the household expenses and with his niece. He views his niece like a daughter because they have raised her together. José sells women’s and men’s clothing. He is now asking for a loan to be able to buy a greater variety of merchandise for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock his inventory

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, de 35 años, es un padre muy responsable y comprensivo, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y lo que más desea es darle una buena vida a su familia.

El trabajo, para Javier, siempre fue una forma de demostrar lo que vale, él ha trabajado en varios oficios y nunca ha tenido miedo de realizar cualquier actividad, ya que siempre se sintió muy feliz de tener trabajo. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando como albañil, que es una actividad que el realiza con mucha destreza, motivo por el cual tiene muchos contratos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es construir casas, ya que siente que con su trabajo está ayudando a una familia a tener un techo donde vivir. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados tablones que usa para sostener los techos de las casas que construye. 
Para un futuro cercano, desea comprar nuevos materiales que lo ayuden en su trabajo de construcción.

Este es el primer préstamo de Javier con MFP, se siente muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para no fallar en el pago de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de socias. Con los mil soles solicitados, comprará más puntales y tablones, ya que los que tenía están siendo utilizadas en otras obras.
texts.en:
Javier, 35, is a very responsible and understanding father. He lives in the house that he inherited from his parents. What he wants most of all is to give his family a good life. For Javier work was always a way to demonstrate his worth. He has worked at various jobs, and he has never been afraid to do any job. He always felt very happy to have work. He is currently working as a bricklayer. He puts forth great effort doing this job, and he, therefore, has many contracts. What he likes most about his work is building houses. He feels that with his work he is helping a family to have a roof over their heads. He has been doing this work for ten years. The most difficult part is loading the heavy planks he uses to hold up the roofs of the houses he builds. In the near future he would like to buy new materials to help in him in his construction work. This is Javier’s first loan with MFP. He feels very happy to have received the loan. He is prepared to work very hard to not miss making a payment. He is very dear to the other members of his communal bank. He will use the 1,000 PEN he asked for to buy more mainstays and planks. The ones that he had are being used on other jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for his work

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, de 24 años, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en una habitación que le cedieron sus padres y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de sobre salir en la vida. 

El día de Jorge comienza a las 6 de la mañana, cuando abre su puesto de ropa y se alista para empezar a vender su mercadería, él tiene su puesto en el mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), donde atiende durante todo el día y a las 9 de la noche cierra, sabiendo que al día siguiente le espera otra larga jornada de trabajo.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus clientes y convencerlos de que le compren algo, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el mismo lugar. 
Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender ropa más variada.

Este es el primer préstamo de Jorge con MFP y espera pagar todas sus cuotas sin demora, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Jorge, 24, is a very hard-working young man. He lives in the house that his parents left him. He is prepared to work very hard to succeed in life. Jorge’s day starts at six in the morning when he opens his clothing stand and gets ready to start selling his merchandise. He has a stand in the Tupac Amaru Market (a very important market in the city of Juliaca). He tends his stand all day, and he closes at nine at night. He knows that the next day another day’s work awaits him. What he likes most about his business is talking with his customers and convincing them to buy something. He has been doing this for five years. The most difficult part is having to stay all day in the same place. In the future he hopes to have a larger store where he can sell a larger variety of clothing. This is Jorge’s first loan with MFP. He expects to make all of his payments without fail. He does not want to cause problems for the members of his communal bank, where he is much loved. He will use the 1,000 PEN that he has asked for to buy more clothes to better set up his sales location.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, de 23 años, es una amorosa madre de familia, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Eusebio) de 27 años, y sus 2 hijos: Yeslim de 4 y Luz de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

El puesto de Lucila está ubicado en la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca, ella vende productos andinos (Cañihua, Quinua, etc.), es de las pocas vendedoras que tiene un negocio de este rubro en el mercado, por lo cual tiene muchos clientes y vende casi toda su mercadería, lo cual le da los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que es muy alegre y siempre les saca una sonrisa. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta. Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender productos variados, incluyendo sus productos andinos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Lucila con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los seiscientos soles solicitados comprará más productos andinos, los cuales espera vender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Lucila is a loving mother who lives in her own house with her twenty-seven-year-old husband, Eusebio, and her two children : Yeslim, who is four, and Luz, who is two. They are the driving force behind all of her efforts. Her work stall is located in the Sunday street market in the city of Juliaca. She sells Andean products (Cañihua, Quinua, etc.) and is one of the few vendors of this line of products in the market. For this reason, she has many clients and sells almost all of her merchandise, which gives her the income necessary to support her family. What she likes most about her job is having conversations with her clients; she is very happy and always smiling. She's been working for three years in her currrent position and thinks that the most diffficult aspect of the job is to have to stay all day in the same stall. In the future, she hopes to have a store where she can sell various products, including her Andean merchandise. This is Lucila's first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she hopes to be very punctual with her payments. She is very well regarded within her communal bank for the order she brings to the meetings. With the requested funds, she will purchase more Andean products, which she hopes to sell to more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise inventory

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, de 36 años, es una madre muy alegre y amorosa, vive con su hijo (Paolo) de 16 años. La casa donde vive se la dieron a cuidar, y por el momento es su vivienda.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso en un puesto ubicado en la avenida “Costanera” de la ciudad de Puno (lugar donde se hacen ferias de ropa de segunda mano en esta ciudad), ella vende todo tipo de ropa, ya que compra por fardos cerrados la vestimenta americana que llega a nuestro país.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lo cual hace menos fastidiosas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poderlo descuidar. Con el tiempo, anhela tener una tienda de ropa donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad sus prendas de vestir.

Este es el primer préstamo de Mercedes con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo para no meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los mil soles solicitados, comprará más fardos de ropa para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su puesto.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 36-years-old and is a very happy and loving mother who lives with her son, Paolo, who is 16. They live in a house that they take care of.

Mercedes sells secondhand clothing in a stall located on "Costanera" Avenue in the city of Puno. She sells all kinds of clothing and buys a variety of clothes sent from the US to be sold in Peru. What she likes most about her work is chatting with her fellow salespeople, which makes her long days of work less tiresome. She has been doing this work for three years and believes the hardest part is having to stay all day in her sales stall without being able to leave. In the future, she longs to have a clothing store where she can sell her garments with greater ease.

This is Mercedes' first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she knows she has to pay on time in order to not have problems with the members of her communal bank, where she is appreciated. With the 1000 Peruvian soles she has requested, she will buy more bundles of clothing in order to increase the quantity of merchandise she has in her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Gleysi Del Socorro

texts.en: Gleysi has three children, ages 13, 9 and 5. The youngest is not yet in school, but the older two attend.  Gleysi started her clothing sales business 12 years ago when her husband left her and she had just had her first child. This business has provided her enough income to support her family all these years. Gleysi has a very good credit history with Fundacion Leon 2000. She dreams of building her own home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria is 32 years old and has two children of the ages six and ten. She began her food sale business six years ago in order to provide a method of improving the quality of life she was providing for her children.  She says that it was necessary because the father of the children didn’t help to support them. She dreams of having an established location for her restaurant, she would like to be better able to serve her clients. Providing a comfortable space for them would be her dream. As a current challenge, Ana Maria faces a lot of competition from other food vendors nearby. Ana Maria has a good credit history with Fundacion Leon 2000.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 32 years old and has two children of the ages six and ten. She began her food sale business six years ago in order to provide a method of improving the quality of life she was providing for her children. She says that it was necessary because the father of the children didn’t help to support them. She dreams of having an established location for her restaurant, she would like to be better able to serve her clients. Providing a comfortable space for them would be her dream. As a current challenge, Ana Maria faces a lot of competition from other food vendors nearby. Ana Maria has a good credit history with Fundacion Leon 2000.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Gloria Josefina Bonilla Avilés De Pereira

texts.es: Gloria Josefina B. A. D. P. vive en el municipio D. Colon del departamento D. La Libertad junto esposo y sus dos hijas. Gloria tiene 54 años D. edad, hace siete años ella se dio a la lucha D. emprender su propio negocio, un taller D. costura, el maneja desD. su casa. Gloria es una mujer muy alegre, cada día pone lo mejor D. sí en sus confecciones, ya que ella manifiesta que la costura y el diseño son una gran pasión en su vida y es así como ve el trabajo D. todos los días, con un entusiasmo y espíritu emprendedor en su negocio. Ahora ella solicita D. un crédito para poder comprar nuevos cortes en tela y así seguir elaborando D. sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Gloria Josefina B. A. D. P., 54, lives in the town of Colon, which is in the La Libertad department, with her husband and two daughters. Seven years ago she took on the challenge of running her own business, a sewing workshop, which she operates from her home. Gloria is a cheerful woman who puts her best into each of her creations every day; she states that clothing design and manufacture is her life's great passion and that's how she views her daily work, with enthusiasm and an entrepreneurial spirit. She requests this loan to buy new fabric selections so that she can continue making her dresses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric for clothing manufacture.

borrowers.first_name: Gloria Josefina Bonilla Avilés De Pereira

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This is the client’s fourth loan from the microfinance institution. The loan is to buy inventory for his electronics shop: DVD players and DVDs. The client has a good repayment history with the microfinance institution. He is timely and punctual. He has been able to generate good income with the help from the previous loans.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Opening a Chinese restaurant might seem to be a unique calling for a guy who is originally from Mexico, but Jose takes pride in the fact that his restaurant is the only Chinese restaurant in his neighborhood. He always knew he wanted to run his own restaurant, and when the restaurant he used to work at was forced to close down, he started up a new one in the same building. 

Even with the recession, Jose says the business has done well, especially because of his unique status. He wants to take advantage of the fact that many restaurants are closing and that he is able to get their old equipment on sale. He also wants to invest in new equipment for the restaurant, like a cooking range, freezer, and deep fryer. 

In the future, Jose sees himself opening another branch of his restaurant, or possibly a second restaurant. Having a restaurant is a lot of work - Jose says that "having a restaurant is like having another wife," but thankfully his wife works at the restaurant as well. Overall, Jose says having his own place has been good for his personal life - he can be his own boss, and he has gotten to know many more people in his community as a result.

loans.use: To buy a cooking range, freezer, fryer, and other equipment; neon sign for store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wholesale and sample sale clothing in bulk

loans.name: Daniel Santos

texts.en: Daniel is married with three children at the ages of 15, 13 and 8 years. His business is in the elaboration of bricks and tiles for the construction of homes and roofs. He will use this loan to purchase materials such as wood and clay needed to form the bricks and tiles. Daniel learned this trade from his father and has spent his years mastering the skills. Little by little, he has managed to establish his own workshop; he now has two kilns and established clients. Previous loans from Fundacion Leon 2000 have helped him to acquire his own truck and some cattle. He has seen a drop in the demand for his product in recent months. Daniel dreams that his children will have successful futures and that economic conditions improve for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to form bricks and tiles

loans.name: Heroina Del Consuelo

texts.es: Heroína Consuelo R. S. tiene 52 años, hace más de 13 años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de raspado. Este un helado típico que se vende a un precio accesible y su elaboración es muy fácil. Además  ella labora como docente en un colegio público, pero sus ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos necesarios de su familia, es por eso que acude a esta actividad económica que inicio vendiendo estos productos de manera ambulante en las calles, por lo que ha ido creciendo poco a poco hasta ahora tiene un triciclo en donde ofrece sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo. ella sueña con poder ofrecerle a su hijo los estudios universitarios ya que actualmente no pude ofrecerle esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Heroína Consuelo R. S. is 52 years old and has been in the shaved ice business for 13 years. This is icy treat that is sold at a reasonable price and is very easy to make. She is also a docent at a public school, but her income isn’t enough to cover her family’s expenses, which is why she began selling her products as a mobile vendor. Her business has grown little by little, and now has a tricycle from which she sells her shaved ice. The financing she is requesting will go towards working capital. Her dream is to provide her son with a university education, as she cannot currently afford to provide him with one.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es: Oswaldo es casado, tiene una bebe, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido del bebe,  esta solicitando  su 2do credito para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es comprar zinc para cambiar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado, se desempeña como docente de primaria, ama su trabajo ya que ha ayudado a niños campesinos de la comarca San Pablo, a pesar que el profesor Oswaldo ya no vive con su  ancianita mamá siempre sigue al pendiente de ella ya son una familia  muy unida, es un Joven con mucha responsabilidad, honesto, trabajador y muy querido por los pobladores de su  comunidad,el se siente agradecido con AFODENIC ya que con el credito anterior logro terminar su casa, aspira para el proximo año seguir estudiando  su sueño es tener trabajo para sacar a su hijo adelante  para que a su familia no le falte nada y salud.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is married, has a baby, and his wife takes care of the household chores and caring for the baby. He is soliciting his second loan to invest in home improvements, like buying zinc for a new roof, since his current one is in poor repair. He works as a primary school teacher and he loves his work because he has helped rural children from the San Pablo region. Also, despite the fact that Oswaldo no longer lives with his elderly mother, he continues to devote himself to her – they are a very tight family. He is very responsible, honest, hard-working, and well-liked by the inhabitants of his community. He feels grateful to AFODENIC, because with the previous loan he was able to finish his house. He hopes to continue studying next year, and his dream is have a job that can allow his child to prosper, his family to be healthy and for them to never go without.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos es soltero, no tiene hijos, labora en el Instituto de Nueva Guinea como maestro de educacion primaria, vive en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea junto su mamá quien tambien es maestra, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para construir una  habitación y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar y tener mas privacidad,   este joven se ha caracterizado por ser un docente  muy responsable, honesto, de buena conducta y moral crediticia, profesa la religion evangelica; el y su mamá  son una familia bien unida y comparten con los gastos econòmicos de su casa,  han luchado para seguir  adelante y para seguir estudiando,   este cliente con el crédito anterior logró  comprar dos solares, pues  sueña con tener una vivienda propia con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, seguir estudiando y salud.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is single, he does not have any children, and he works in the New Guinea Institute as a primary school teacher. He lives in Zone #1 in New Guinea with his mother who is also a teacher. He is seeking his second loan from the AFODENIC institution in order to build a new room and thus improve his home's living conditions, adding more privacy for himself. He has shown himself to be a decent, very responsible, honest, well-behaved, and moral borrower. He practices the Evangelical Christan religion. He and his mother make a truly united family, sharing the responsibility for their household expenses, fighting to prosper, and to continue studying. With his prior loan, this borrower was able to buy two plots of land, and he now hopes to have his own home with better conditions, have stable employment, take care of his health, and continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a new room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a bus engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Ericka Delfina

texts.en:
Ericka is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called El Amanecer, which means daybreak in Spanish. She is from Cusco and lives in Cusco. She is 24 years old and single with two children. One studies and the other is still a baby.

Ericka has sold groceries out of her house for the past two years and takes cares of her children. She will use this loan to buy more groceries to sell.  She sells approximately 200 – 250 soles per month.

Ericka appreciates and thanks you for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Benita Milena

texts.es: La Señora Benita se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que gracias a esta pequeña actividad ha logrado salir adelante. Ella no tuvo la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios por lo que solamente tiene educación primaria, ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, el cual lucha cada día por ofrecerle los estudios necesarios. Benita solicita este financiamiento para la compra de sus productos por lo que tendrá mucha más oportunidad de ofrecerle a sus clientes lo que necesitan. Lo que ella desea es que su negocio se convierta en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Benita owns a general store, and has run this store for more than five years. Thanks to this modest activity, she has been able to prosper. She never had the opportunity to finish her studies, so she only has a primary education. She is a single mother, caring for one child, and she fights every day to provide him his necessary studies. Benita seeks this loan for the purchase of more products so that she can a better chance to provide her clients with what they need. Her wish is to eventually convert her business into a full distribution company.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cola nuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cows, goats, and sheep for meat

loans.name: Nelly Nancy

texts.es:
La señora NELLY NANCY S. A., tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LUIS ALBERTO S.. Presenta estudios hasta 1ero. de secundaria porque debido a la falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar estudiando y empezó a trabajar para ayudar a  su familia y cubrir sus propios gastos. Ella es soltera y no tiene hijos, se dedica la venta de arroz,  aceite, leche, jugos,  galletas,  gaseosas,  golosinas,  etc. en la tienda que tiene en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró tela de peluches, hilos, relleno de  fibra, algodón, etc. 
Con este crédito de 700.00 comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, atún, aceite, galletas, gaseosas, jugos, etc. para surtir su tienda que tiene en su casa.
Nelly sueña con ampliar su tienda y ganar cada día mas clientes para así poder obtener mayores ganacias.
texts.en:
Nelly Nancy S. A., 42, lives in the Las Delicias district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Luis Alberto S. Communal Bank. She went to school until her first year of high school. Due to the lack of economic resources, she could not continue studying. She started to work to help her family and to cover her own expenses. She is single and does not have children. She sells rice, oil, milk, juice, crackers, soft drinks, and sweets in the store that she has in her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought fabric for stuffed animals, thread, fiber stuffing, and cotton, etc. With this loan for 700 PEN she will buy rice, sugar, noodles, tuna, oil, crackers, soft drinks, and juice, etc. to stock the store she has in her house. Nelly dreams of expanding her store and gaining more customers everyday in order to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, noodles, tuna, oil, crackers, soft drinks, and juice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda  es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 58 años, es madre D. 5 hijos, todos mayores D. edad. Olinda se dedica a la venta D. salchipapas (comida rápida) por las noches en la vereda D. su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días junto a su esposo. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús” desD. hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas y papas. Actualmente requiere un crédito D. 1200 soles, monto que será utilizado en insumos para salchicha: pollos, papas y gaseosas. La meta D. Olinda es ampliar su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Olinda is a hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in Ucayali region. She is 58 years old and the mother of 5 adult children. She sells salchipapas (a form of fast food maD. of sausages and potatoes) at night on the sidewalk in front of her house. Her husband helps her with the business.

Four years ago, Olinda joined the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy sodas and potatoes. At the moment, she is requesting a new loan of 1200 soles to purchase supplies such as chicken, potatoes, and sodas. Her goal is to increase her business so that she can obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies such as chicken, potatoes, and sodas

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Jacinto R. O. tiene 54 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, el siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable y además siempre se ha hecho cargo de sus 2 hijos, por lo que tenía que buscar un medio de ingreso para su familia, y fue así que comenzó este negocio pero su dificultad es encontrar a un buen cerdo y que últimamente ha sido muy difícil mantener el alimento de estos animales, a pesar de estas dificultades  ha logrado salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo. el sueña con proporcionarle a sus hijos una mejora calidad de vida y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jacinto R. O. is 54 years old and has been buying and selling pigs for more than 8 years. He is a very responsible man who has always taken care of his 2 children. Jacinto started this business as a means of generating income for his family. His main difficulties have been acquiring good animals and keeping them well-fed. Despite these challenges, he has been able to stay ahead. The loan he is requesting will be used has operating capital. Jacinto dreams of providing his children with a better quality of life and generating better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for breeding pigs

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La señora VICENTINA P. M., tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE UNIDAS. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria. Vicentina es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 1 dependen económicamente de ella porque él tiene una enfermedad crónica que requiere de cuidados y de atención. Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales como: patos, carneros, pavos y pollos en su casa huerta.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró alimentos para los animales y también compró pavos y patos para su crianza y posterior venta.
Con este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles volverá a comprar alimentos por sacos para los patos y pavos para poder así estar abastecida para las ventas de fin de año.
Vicentina sueña con empezar a criar vacas para así iniciar a vender leche y obtener mas dinero para los medicamentos de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vicentina P. M. is 42 years old, lives in the Las Delicias district of the Trujillo province in La Libertad, Peru, and is a member of the community bank Siempre Unidas. She has a high school education. Vicentina is married and has 4 children, of whom only one is a dependent, as he is chronically ill and requires a lot of care and attention. For a living she raises farm animals such as ducks, sheep, turkeys and chickens on her farm. She used her first loan of 300 nuevos soles to purchase food for the animals and more turkeys and ducks to raise and sell. With this new loan of 1000 nuevos soles she will purchase more sacks of food for her ducks and turkeys so she can be fully stocked and prepared for the end of year sales. Vicentina dreams of raising diary cows in order to sell milk and earn more money for her son’s medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase food for ducks and turkeys

loans.name: Martha De Los Santos

texts.es: Martha de los Santos tiene 30 años, a esta edad ella ha aprendido a luchar a mantener activo su negocio. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y está ubicado en su vivienda por lo que tenía 1 hijo a su cargo. Poco a poco Martha ha ido creciendo con su negocio, a pesar de las dificultades como brindar el espacio suficiente para colocar sus productos en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, detergentes y pan. Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha de los Santos, 30, has learned how to struggle to maintain her business. She has run a small grocery store, located in her home becuse she has a small child in her care, for the past 7 years. Little by little Martha has seen her business grow despite the difficulties presented by limited space to display her wares in her home. The loan she is seeking is to buy inventory items like basic grains, snacks, natural beverages, detergens and bread. Her wish is to increase her working capital so that she can earn better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel es soltero, tiene 26 años de edad, es el mayor de 6 hermanos y vive junto a sus padres en el sector La Colorada, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado 45 minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Abel se gana la vida sacando fotos desde hace dos años. Nos cuenta que descubrió su gusto por esta actividad sacando fotos en las fiestas y reuniones organizadas por su familia. Poco a poco aprendió más acerca de la técnicas para ejercer este oficio y desde entonces ha trabajado en este rubro.

Usualmente sus clientes lo llaman cuando quieren que saque fotografias de una fiesta o reunión, luego viaja hasta la ciudad de Chiclayo para revelar las imágenes que entrega a sus dueños en un plazo no mayor de 24 horas. 

Este negocio era su única fuente estable de ingreso económico hasta que hace algunos meses uno de sus hermanos enfermó gravemente y tuvo que dejar esta actividad para dedicarse a otras que le permitieran apoyar a su familia a afrontar los gastos de recuperación. Tuvo que vender su cámara para lograr recaudar la suma de dinero que costaba la terapia de recuperación de su hermano.

Ahora que su hermano ha mejorado Abel quiere retomar la fotografía. Por ese motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprarse una nueva cámara, álbunes y portaretratos con los que pueda relanzar su negocio.

Su mayor anhelo es instalar en Mórrope un laboratorio fotográfico para revelar el mismo sus fotografías. El es un joven emprendedor que reponde a las situaciones difíciles con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Abel is single, 26 years old, and is the oldest of 6 siblings. He lives with his parents in the La Colorada area, which is in the Morrope district, located 45 minutes to the north of the city of Chiclayo. For two years, he has made a living taking photographs. He tells us that he discovered his interest in photography by taking photos at parties and get-togethers organized by his family. Little by little he learned more about the techniques needed to carry out this activity as a trade, and ever since he been in this line of work. Usually his customers call him when they want him to take photographs of a party or meeting; later he travels to the city of Chiclayo to develop the images and then he delivers them to the owners within a period not exceeding 24 hours. This business was his only stable source of income until a few months ago, when one of his brothers became gravely ill and he had to leave this activity to engage in other activities that would allow him to support his family in meeting the costs of recuperation. He had to sell his camera to raise money to pay for the therapy that his brother needed in order to recover. Now that his brother is better, Abel would like to resume his photography business. For this reason he has requested a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. This loan will be used to buy a new camera, photo albums and photo frames with which he can relaunch his business. He main wish is to have a photographic laboratory in Morrope where he can develop his own photographs. He is a young entrepreneur who responds to difficult situations with responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a camera and photo albums for the maintenance of his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth) and scarves

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa; sus cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 7 y 3 años de edad; su madre y su sobrino en el sector Cruz del Médano, perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, ubicado una hora al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de animales menores. Empezó trabajando como agricultor pero los continuos problemas de escasez de agua para la irrigación de los sembríos en la zona hizo que poco a poco dejara de sembrar y que le dedicara más tiempo a la crianza y venta de animales.

Jorge compra animales para luego criarlos y venderlos a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Usualmente cría cerdos, pavos, patos y cuyes. Las continua necesidad por la que atraviesa su familia y el incremento de la demanda por parte de sus compradores han hecho que planee ampliar su negocio por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compa de más animales.

El nos cuenta que su mayor anhelo es poder construir su casa de material noble (de ladrillos y cemento) y brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar alguna carrera superior. El es un padre responsable que siempre trabaja dando lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 44-year old father who lives with his wife, his 4 children - ages 12, 10, 7, and 3 - and his mother and nephew. They live in the Cruz del Médano sector, belonging to the district of Mórrope, located an hour north of the city of Chiclayo.

He works in agriculture and the sale of small animals. He began working as a farmer but the continuous problems of water scarcity for crop irrigation in the area caused him to little by little leave farming and dedicate more time to raising and selling animals.

Jorge buys animals to raise them and sell them to businessmen that frequent the area. He usually raises pigs, turkeys, duck, and guinea pigs. The continuous necessity of his family is the increased demand that his customers have. For this reason he plans to grow his business and this is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to invest in purchasing more animals.

He tells us that his greatest longing is to be able to build his house of noble materials (brick and cement) and provide his children with the opportunity to for advanced studies. He is a responsible father who always gives his best in his work in order to take care of himself and his own.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor M. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Eleonor is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonor operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling shrimp and other varieties of fish in the local community. Eleonor has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eleonor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleonor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Eleonor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Eleonor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Gelisah Fay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Gelisah Fay is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business and used as an additional capital of the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Gelisah Fay from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children and save as a reserve for future needs of the family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding and additional capital for the business

location.town: Happy Valley  Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 58 years old, and married to Leopoldo, who works as a farmer. They have four loving children namely; Rubelyn and Dolores who are both farmers, followed by Benedicto, a company truck driver, and Roland, also a farmer They are presently residing in the village of Del C., Cabatuan, Isabela province. Their house is located near their rice farm and at the back of it is their piggery.

Angelita has managed a livestock business (hog-raising) for almost ten years. Her net income is Php 4,000.00 a month. She would like to make a loan in the amount of Php 5,000.00 to use in the renovation of her pig pens, because of slight damage caused during to typhoons. She hopes and prays that KIVA will grant her the loan. She will also use the loan to purchase hog feed and young piglets to raise. Angelita wants to live a life that is full of happiness. Even though they sometimes have no money, she has earns to have a contentment.

loans.use: Hog feed and renovation of pig pens

loans.name: Harizon

texts.en:
Harizon G. is 35 years old and he is a resident of Barangay Mozzozzin Norte, Sta.Maria Isabela. He has been separated for five years now, and has one child to support.

Harizon has operated a sari-sari store business (community based store) in their village for four years. He would like his business to grow for it is a great help in meeting the needs of his family. With this income, he is able to send his only child to school in order to complete his education and have a brighter future someday. Now, he wants to borrow additional capital for his business to buy more stock for the improvement of his store. He is requesting PHP 5,000 and this will be used to buy more stock to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more stocks of products to sell in his store

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia L. is from the village of Makawa Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Abundia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Abundia owns & operates a business venture operating a manufacturing business. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling "nipa hut" used in making house roofing material to the local community members. Abundia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Abundia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Abundia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Abundia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Abundia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture  "nipa hut" used in making house roofs.

loans.name: Norielyn

texts.en:
"Diligent and patience corresponds to success", says Norielyn R., 26 years of age. Norielyn manages a small retail store located in front of her house. Her a gross income is Php 5,000.00 monthly. The family's major source of income is farming, but they still need to work hard and earn enough money to sustain their daily needs. She is requesting a loan of Php 5,000.00, and will use it to purchase additional grocery commodities to sell in her mini stall.

Norielyn reside in the village of Sillawit, Cauayan City.  Isabela lives with her husband and their one year old son. Their house is located along the national highway going to Alicia, Isabela. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her desired loan request, because she believes that it will be a great help for her to reach her goals in life.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Eliada

texts.en:
Eliada L. is from the village of San Juan , Pana-on,Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Eliada is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eliada owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector harvesting corn. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice and corn in the local community. Eliada has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eliada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Eliada is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to buy fertilizer. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Eliada from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Concejo

texts.en:
At the age of 54 and having three children, Mrs. Concejo G. is still looking for another source of income. She is from the village of San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela. She is engaged in the business of retailing goods with her small general store. She just started her business one year ago. Concejo is luckily married to her husband named Ysmael. He is a laborer in a buying station in Aurora, Isabela.

Concejo operates her business with faith that she can improve it in time. Her business is her only source of income, and it will help her husband in covering her family’s expenditures. She wanted to borrow the amount of 5,000 PHP for additional capital for her general store. She wants to add some items to sell to be able to increase her income.

loans.use: Additioanl capital to buy more items for her store

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
With her one year of experience in her business fattening pigs, Corazon wants to continue until she reaches her dreams in life. She is from the village of Santiago, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 44 years of age and married to Jose, who is 43 years old. They are blessed with two children named Marlon and Editha. Marlon is a high-school graduate and has his own family, while Editha is presently taking her first year of college education.

Corazon dreams of seeing her child finish her education and have her own job for her future. She doesn’t have any wealth for her child to inherit, and she knows that education is the only wealth that she can give. Her business serves her in providing for her child's tuition fees during times of examination. She planned to sell her pigs because she does not have enough resources to cover her pigs' feed. When she heard about the program, she was interested, and finally she joined the program. She wanted to borrow the amount of 5,000 PHP for the purchase of pig feed, so they will become healthy and have a heavy weight when they are sold to buyers.

loans.use: Maintenance of her pigs

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
At the age of 54, Mrs. Roberta D. is still looking for another source of income. Roberta is from the village of Aurora, Isabela, and is engaged in the business of retailing goods in her general store. She has already been in business five years, and she dreams of many more years in business. Her business serves her in covering her three children's expenditures in their studies. Two children are about to graduate and finish their studies.

Roberta dreams of succeeding in sending her children to school through the help of her business. At times she suffers shortages to cover her family’s expenditures, but she has strong faith to fulfill it all. Her husband, named Eduardo, is her helper in carrying her family’s difficulties. He is working in a rice mill as a classifier of rice. His salary and his wife's income are insufficient to sustain their needs in general. Roberta wants to improve her business for bigger income. She wants to borrow the amount of 5,000 PHP for additional capital, and to improve her business. She wants to have additional items for her store.

loans.use: For additional items to sell in her store

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Sofonias

texts.en:
Sofonias Y. is from the village of Lower Lilingayon, Valencia City. He is 45 years old. Sofonias is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Sofonias runs a bakeshop. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Sofonias has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sofonias joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sofonias is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sofonias from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela T. is from the village of Puntian, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Estela is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Estela runs a bakeshop. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Estela has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Estela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. Estela is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Estela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Nedee

texts.en:
Nedee T. is from the village of  Batangan, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 26 years old and married. To make a living, Nedee owns & operates a business  in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal products like cosmetics, ladies wear and other items in the local community. Nedee has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nedee joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nedee is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nedee from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of cosmetics and ladies wear to sell

loans.name: Zamir

texts.en:
Zamir Ahmad is the son of D. M.. He lives in Jalalabad city. He is a young boy. Even though he is so young, he still feels lots of responsibilities towards his family members. He lives in a family of 7 members, including his father and mother. He is the oldest son in his family. 

Zamir has a sandals shop where he sells different kinds of sandals. He wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the purpose of purchasing more and good quality materials for his shop. In fact, his main purpose is to attract more clients and to purchase items of in high demand in his market. He hopes to develop his business after taking the loan and to bring about changes in his business. He is confident that he will repay his loan on time and will join to take a second cycle loan after the full repayment of first cycle loan. He would like to extend his gratitude to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Salama's Group

texts.en:
N. Salama is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 35 years old and married with 5 children aged 4 to 14 years. She also takes care of her other siblings. Salama has been a tailor ever since she started working in Kitega 13 years ago and she is able to make 150,000UGX  profit a week. She says that she has been able to succeed because of the use of her loans and by giving good customer care that has helped her win more customers. 

N.  has a dream of becoming a wholesaler in the future. She wants to start a tailoring school and teach other people the same trade at a fee. N. also wants to educate her children to the University level. Her loans have helped her to buy a steady supply of clothes for her customers and she would like to have a loan to be able to buy more clothes for sewing and for resale.

loans.use: To buy supplies of clothes for sewing and resale.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa T. is from the village of Buyog Banlag, Valencia City. She is 45 years old. Marissa is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Marissa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marissa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marissa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marissa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Naimullah

texts.en:
Naimullah is the son of S. W.. He is uneducated he is a baker. He has been involved in this business for more than 8 years, but he still lives in a rental house with his family. He can’t support his family and pay the rent of his house. He wants to buy more flour and wood for his bakeshop. Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis to start his work with more success. This will give him the energy to help his family better than he can now. This will make a bright future for his family.

Note: In this picture of three people, Naimullah is the man on the left side.

loans.use: To buy flour and wood for his bakery.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene S. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Irene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop., selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Irene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Irene is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Jesca's Group

texts.en:
N. Jesca is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a hard working and devoted 32 year old lady. She married with 6 children, who are between six and eighteen years old; additionally, she takes care of her parents.

Jesca is a business lady involved in the sale of agricultural produce. She has done this for 5 years now. Although she is able to make 100,000 a week, she is faced with significant challenges, such as competition from other farmers and the scarcity of produce (especially during some seasons). Jesca is grateful to those who have lent money to her, as the money has that enabled to buy more high quality produce. Jesca dreams of eventually having a wholesale shop and building houses for her children. Currently, however, she needs a loan to be able to recapitalize her business by buying more agricultural produce for resale.

loans.use: purchasing more agricultural products

loans.name: Joecilyn

texts.en:
Joecilyn S. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 33 years old. Joecilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Joecilyn owns and runs a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling foods and soft drinks to the community. Joecilyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Joecilyn joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joecilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joecilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

loans.name: Zakerullah

texts.en:
Zakerullah, son of Q., is married and lives in Jalalabad Nangrahar province. He studied up to class nine. Because of some financial problems, he couldn't continue his education. His father is a good shoemaker who cannot work anymore because he is above 60 years old. Zakerullah decided to help his family and to work in his father’s shoemaker shop. Zakerullah is a hard worker and he wants to enlarge his business. For this purpose he needs 50000 Afghani loans.

He is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to enlarge his shop and to expand his business to be more successful. He wishes to become strong in his business and to make a good monthly income for his family.

loans.use: He wants to buy leather for shoemaking.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred R. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia  City. She is 39 years old. Mildred is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mildred owns and runs a "sari-sari" (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products to the community. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month.

In 2009, Mildred joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mildred from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. it
