loans.name: Phillice Oyiera

texts.en: Phillice is 40 years old, married, and is blessed with five children. She runs a retail business which is located at Gabriel in Eldoret. Phillice was introduced to KADET by an existing member. With the loan she is taking from KADET she intends to add more stock to her shop, including cooking fat, soap, and foodstuffs like flour. Phillice would also like to improve her maize selling business. Her dreams are to educate her children all the way through higher institutions. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add stock to her retail shop

loans.name: Violah Jerotich

texts.en:
Violah is 27 years old, married, and is blessed with one child. She runs a poultry business which is located at Cheplasgei in Eldoret.

Violah was introduced to KADET by a group member. With her loan, she intends to buy chick mash for her poultry. Her dream is to grow her business and be able to educate her child.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy chick mash to feed her poultry

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en:
N. Robinah is a 42-year-old lady, very friendly, hard working and determined, with a business selling fish at Butale trading centre. She is a married lady with eight children aged 29 to 12 years of whom four are in school.

Robinah buys her fish from the landing sites in Mukono, Lugazi and Jinja and she is faced with the challenge of the poor and costly transport network that affects her business.

This is Robinah’s first loan with her group and she hopes to be able to obtain quality fish from it, grow her business, earn more profits for paying school fees for her children, and also improve on the construction of her house.

Robinah needs a loan to help buy more fish for resale and this will enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Thomas Kipngetich

texts.en: Thomas is 40 years old, married, and is blessed with one child. His brick business is located at Lusweti in Eldoret. Thomas wanted to improve his business so he sought out a KADET branch and applied for a loan. With this loan, he will add to his stock of bricks, which are used in construction in the area in which he lives. In the future, Thomas dreams of expanding his business further and receiving better returns so that he can better provide for his family. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase additional bricks for his business

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a Palestinian man living in Bethlehem. He is married with three young daughters. Adel is a sports teacher in a private school in Bethlehem and his wife works in a private school.

Adel estabilished his shop three years ago to have a better income for the family. At his shop he sells all sporting clothes: tracksuits, pants, shorts, tennis shoes, walking shoes and balls. He opens his shop after finishing his work at the school as the area where he opens his shop gets busy in the afternoons. He also opens it all day long on the weekends.

Adel requested 1,500 USD to buy new products for his shop. He appears in the photo at his shop.

loans.use: To purchase new products for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For purchasing needed tools and materials.

loans.name: Peter Claver

texts.en:
Peter is 44 years old, married, and blessed with four children. He runs a general store that is located at Divisional in Eldoret.

He decided to improve his business and therefore sought out a loan from KADET himself. With the loan he is taking from KADET, he intends to buy more stock to sell to customers. Some of these items include cooking oil, cooking fat, rice and sugar. 

His dream is to grow his business and provide for his family.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase  shop inventory

loans.name: Safokhudja

texts.en:
Safokhudja is married with three children. He lives in Isfara and sells spare parts and lubricants. His small facility is favorably located in his countryside is Isfara town. His business is very promising and flourishing. Safokhudja has an individual approach to each of his customers, which has helped him win many loyal clients. He has been in this trade for 13 years. Today he needs a loan of $1500 USD for increasing his inventory. Safokhudja is happy to have access to lending services as additional financial assistance gives him options in his dealings with different suppliers of specific merchandise. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the spare parts for car in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Joyce Kutayi

texts.en:
Joyce is 45 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She sells foodstuffs at Panpaper in Eldoret.  She was introduced to KADET by another group member.

With the loan she is taking from KADET, Joyce intends to add more inventory, including flour, cooking fat, and rice.  Her dreams are to grow her business and educate her children.

b>About KADET:  The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: http://www.kadet.co.ke/

loans.use: To increase  shop inventory

loans.name: Gulomdjon

texts.en: B. Gulomdjon is 52 years old and is married with three children. Thanks to the efforts of Gulomdjon, all of his children are married with their own families. Gulomdjon provides taxi services using his car. He has been in this business for the last two years and has gained a rich experience in driving. He has always tried to provide high quality services and, at the same time, charge prices that are attractive to his customers. Gulomdjon is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable as he is the main bread-winner of his large family. He is ready to work from early morning till late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. Currently, Gulomdjon needs to repair some parts of his car and for this reason he requests 1,500 US Dollars. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of wheat for making cakes

loans.name: Nulu's Group

texts.en: Nulu Sserembais is a 50-year-old married mother of seven children, aged 32 – 15 years, and also takes care of two orphans. A very hardworking and friendly lady, she has been a poultry farmer in Buloba for 24 years, making sufficient profits to help support her family and pay school fees for her children. Nulu's trustworthiness has won her many customers who buy both broilers and eggs. She would like to expand her farm to enable her to continue paying the school fees for her children and is therefore requesting a loan to buy more feed and chicks for her business.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed and chicks for farm expansion.

loans.name: Nazir

texts.en:
Nazir H., 41 years old, married, and the father of four school-aged children, is the main bread-winner in the family, while his wife is a housekeeper who looks after their children. For more than 15 years, Nazir has baked the national bread, “lepeshka”. He arises early and bakes so that people have fresh products on their tables for breakfast, thereby ensuring that the business is profitable and not subject to seasonality. He purchases in the local market all the input materials such as flour, salt, and yeast. Now Nazir requests $1500 to purchase flour and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. Having already borrowed 14 times from IMON International, he has demonstrated himself to be an honest client who repays his loans promptly.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour to bake the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Khusein

texts.en:
Khusein has a minivan with which he provides transportation services. His usual itinerary is the Isfara-Khujand-Isfara route. Having attended to this business for four years, he gained the reach of experience. Initially he rented a car but in time, after making certain savings, he bought his own minivan with the support of his father. The business is stable and generates the main and considerable income for Khusein’s family, allowing an improvement in living conditions.

Currently Khusein’s minivan needs repairing. That’s why he needs a loan of 4,000 Somoni. Khusein thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his minivan

loans.name: Agil

texts.en:
Agil was born in 1988. He lives in Fuzuli region. 4 years ago he started taxi business. He is single.
Now this young man seeks a loan of 1500 AZN to buy the spare parts to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is 33 years old and is single. He is in the business of buying and selling gas cylinders in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. John's business is 2 years old and is doing well.

John is taking out his first loan from KADET and with the 50,000 KES loan he plans to buy gas cylinders and to also purchase distilled water. He sells gas to residents of Mshomoroni and he says he is proud of the success he has been able to have with his business. 

John hopes to expand his business and open up more locations in different areas of the coastal city of Mombasa.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders and distilled water to sell to customers

loans.name: Gaibullodjon

texts.en:
Gaibullodjon S. is 42 years old. He is married with two children. Gaibullodjon has been processing and selling dried apricots for 15 years. His wife and his children help him with processing the apricots at his house. This season he wants to expand his business and purchase more dried apricots. Gaibullodjon is asking for a loan of $1500 USD. He wants to buy more dried apricot in order to process them and to sell during market times. Be an important part of the growth of Gaibullodjon’s business.

loans.name: Helida Atieno

texts.en:
Helida is 57 years old, married and is blessed with five children. Her business is located at Kona in Eldoret.

She was introduced to KADET by Patrick Mwangi. With the loan she is taking from KADET, Helida plans to purchase more maize stock to sell to customers. Her dream is to improve her business and to be able to afford a permanent home one day for her family. 


About KADET:  The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. loans.use: To buy a motorcyle taxi

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew K. is a 32 year old married father of two children. He is married to Cecilia Muthike. The family lives in Kongowea, Mombasa. 

Mathew runs a shoe sales stall and sells different kinds of men's, women's and children's shoes. He has been in this business for the last 9 years and considers it a success. He is currently borrowing his first KADET loan and with it he plans to increase his stock of shoes and to improve the premises from which he sells his stock. Kongowea is a busy market area and Mathew is able to reach out to many customers with ease.

In the future, Mathew hopes to become a major shoe supplier and to also venture into the clothing sale business.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase stock of shoes and to improve the premises from which he sells his stocks

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson Maundu is a 35 year old married father of two children. Nelson and his family live in Shanzu, Mombasa and he runs a food stall in the same area. He has been selling food for 3 year now.

Nelson is currently accessing his first loan from KADET. With the money he plans to refurbish his stall by buying new furniture and to improve his cooking by purchasing meat stock. His main clients are casual workers in the area who enjoy his services.

Nelson hopes to improve the condition of his working premises and run a bigger hotel (cafe) in Shanzu one day.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To refurbish his stall (buy furniture) and to also purchase meat stock to serve to customers

loans.name: Abdul Basher

texts.en:
A. Basher is the son of A. M.. He is married and has 5 children, three sons and two daughters. His youngest son is a college student, in first year and the others are students at school. He has a mobile phone sales shop in the city of Kabul and he needs a small loan for his business to become strong and to help with his family.

He is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani. He wants to expand and develop his business. He wants to buy more mobile phones and to complete the stock of inventory for his shop and to work hard.

He is very happy to have this process of small loans in Afghanistan and especially wants to thank the Kiva lenders around the world for this process.

loans.use: Towards expanding his business.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en:
A. Akmal is 31 years old. He is married with three children. From the time he was young, Akmal learned to work in a small business with his parents. With a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer in agriculture in the area where he lived. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice and seeing his family progressing more and more. With the income Akmal was able to open a dispensary in his house and also raise the cattle successfully. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children and see them as professional, ethical and hardworking. For this reason he is asking a loan of $750 USD. He wants this loan to buy livestock, as raising and selling the animals generates an excellent profit margin. Be an important part of the growth of Akmal’s business.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Gilufar

texts.en:
Gilufar K. is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has three children. She works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity created in her feelings of satisfaction because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes feeding the animals and supplying them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and so now she guides them into the field each day for feeding. Gilufar makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her adorable children. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling commercially. It is for this reason that Gilufar is requesting a loan of $800 USD to buy more young cattle and fodder for her animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.name: Alice Nelima

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old, married and is blessed with four children. She has been a butcher for the past four years. Her business is located at Kona and her major clients are residents of Matunda, Kona and Brigadier (within Matunda) in Eldoret.

She was introduced to KADET by a neighbour. With the loan she is taking from KADET she intends to buy a cow to butcher. Her dreams are to grow her business, be able to improve her living stanadards and to educate her children.

About KADET:  The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. loans.name: Yorkinoy

texts.en:
Yorkinoy is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She is a hardworking woman who has always found a way to settle her family's expenses. Every day, for the whole day, Yorkinoy tends to her general store, and that is how she contributes to her household's economy because her husband's income is often not enough. Four years ago she set up her own general store, which from the beginning has offered all sorts of products such as souvenirs, dishes and other household products. Yorkinoy works every day to feed her children and to provide them with the best future. She requests this loan to purchase more merchandise to stock her store with a variety of products.

texts.en:
Machakha is 34 years old, married and blessed with three children. His hawking business is located at Matunda in Eldoret. He sells small household items from location to location.

He was introduced to KADET by Phanice naliaka.

He is planning use this loan to add small stock to his hawking business in order to serve the community well. His future plans are to have a permanent home and improve his business in order to create employment for the community.

Bessy was introduced to KADET by an existing client and is now accessing her first loan. She plans to increase beauty products stock in her salon with the money. Her clients are mostly the residents of Shanzu.

She hopes to grow her business so that it becomes a chain of beauty salons in the coastal city to maximize her income.

loans.name: Saidmurot

texts.en:
Saidmurot M. is 43 years old and was born in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is the father of three children and his main work consists of breeding cattle. This very profitable activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, Saidmurot would like to buy a greater number of cattle and to build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, Saidmurot is asking for a loan of 800 USD for the realization of this project. His goals is to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family.

loans.name: Mamur

texts.en:
Mamur M. is 37 years old. He is married with four children. Mamur has opted to make his life in his land and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to rear cows and dedicated himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background and now he is in charge of handing down all that experience to his children. Today Mamur wishes to increase the number of his cattle. He would like to buy cows with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home. That’s why he is requesting a loan of $750 USD. Extend your solidarity to Mamur so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora O. is 36 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. 
Gulnora breeds cattle. She buys the calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. Her husband also attends to this business. Gulnora works hard in order to make the business successful and to generate a stable income for the family. Today Gulnora is planning to purchase the cattle for her household to raise and sell. For this purpose she requests $800 US Dollars. Gulnora would like to thank everyone for support and promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Hayatullah

texts.en:
Hayatullah, son of Gullah Jan, is married and lives with his family in Afghanistan. He is a very honest, hard working, and talented man. For five years, he has been working in a lab; however, he has not been able to buy a microscope for his laboratory during this time. After trying his best, he bought land a month ago and needs money to build on it. 

He is applying for an individual loan to buy a microscope for his shop. He is hopeful that through this loan, he can improve his livelihood and contribute more fully to his country.

loans.use: To buy a microscope

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba O. is 38 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of 5 children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now Nasiba dedicates herself to raising and selling the cattle and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy. Nasiba asks for a loan of $800 USD to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en: Ilhom is a hardworking person and he makes an effort to give his two beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he feeds his animals. With experience gained over ten years in the purchase and sale of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family. His wife helps him with the business. Ilhom would now like to purchase more cattle in order to create more income for his large family. For this reason he requests a loan of 4,000 Somoni. Ilhom thanks you very much for your love of the prodigal. loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Meresa Atieno

texts.en:
Meresa A. has been running a boutique for the past nine years in Eldoret town. She is 47 years old, married to A. and they are blessed with three children. She was introduced to KADET by a friend. She has requested a loan which she intends to use to add more clothing materials to her boutique shop. Her dream is to grow her business, educate her children and, as she puts it, "God willing," to buy a pickup.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To add more clothing materials to her boutique shop

loans.name: Navkiron

texts.en:
U. Navkiron has a great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for eight years. He is 28 years old and married with two children. Navkiron would like to expand his business by adding additional cows to the ones he has. This is because he recently acquired out-of-town orders to supply milk. Navkiron is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni in order to buy another cow and feed. With additional income, Navkiron will be better able to meet his family's financial obligations and, especially, to provide for the education of his children.

loans.use: To purchasing cattle

loans.name: Ngone

texts.fr: Madame Ngone B. est membre de la caisse de OUAKAM DEPUIS UNE dizaine d années.C est une femme dynamique qui collabore positivement avec la caisse.Elle est même parvenu a faire adhérer tous ses enfants a la caisse.Elle a déjà bénéficié de 4 crédits qui lui ont permis de construire étape par étape des chambres qui sont destines a la location.Actuellement elle dispose de 6 chambres qui lui génère des revenus.La maison qui abrite ces chambres lui a été acquise par héritage de ses parents.C est une veuve qui a en charge un enfant mineur ainsi que sa mère.Le reste de ses enfants sont majeurs.L objet de son crédit est la construction de chambres qui lui permettront d accroitre ses revenus et d améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.Ainsi elle pourra renforcer son épargne et en cas de besoin résoudre les problèmes ponctuels.
texts.en:
Ms. Ngone B. has been a member of the Ouakam fund for about ten years. She is a dynamic woman who has collaborated positively with the fund. She has even managed to get all her children to join the fund. She has already benefited from four previous loans that allowed her to build, in stages, some rooms that are destined to be rented out. Currently, she has six rooms that provide her with income. The house that contains these rooms was passed down to her from her parents. She is a widow who has one young child in her care, as well as her mother. The rest of her children are grown up. The goal of this loan is to build more rooms, which will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. In this way, she will be able to strengthen her savings and, in times of need, resolve occasional problems.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build rooms for rent

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
U. Shavkat raises animals and his cows are what are the most profitable. He is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two children. Shavkat has been in this business with his father (in the photo) for seven years. During that time, early every morning he goes to the various grazing fields near where he lives to feed his stock and take them to rivers or nearby lagoons so they can drink water. This takes him all day to do until sunset, and he returns home tired from the constant daytime sun and the terrible cold during the afternoon. But he likes his work. Shavkat knows he must feed and care for his animals very well. He would like to invest in the purchase of cattle, so he can increase the stock of cattle he takes to the market to sell. Shavkat is counting on your help. With your support, he can improve his family's life.
